text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Is Dexamethasone really a vitamin? FALSE! DEXAMETHASONE does not prevent people from getting COVID-19! The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) STRONGLY reminds the public that Dexamethasone is a prescription drug and should strictly be used under the supervision of a licensed physician. This comes after a netizen exposed the fact that Dexamethasone was being sold as an over-the-counter medication in Shopee, an online shopping platform. After gaining many retweets, the Shopee twitter account said the product has since been removed. "We will work harder to stop misinformation on our platform." said the company in a tweet. Dexamethasone has suddenly gained notoriety after it was hailed as a "life-saving" medication which cuts the risk of death for patients on a ventilator by a third, and for those on oxygen by a fifth. With that said, the result of these findings was closely monitored by experts as part of the clinical trials to explore possible treatments for COVID-19. This was considered risky mainly because at the start of the pandemic, most international guidelines strongly discouraged the use of steroids for Covid-19. Steroids had been tried during outbreaks of two other deadly coronaviruses, Sars and Mers, with mixed results. The study that dexamethasone is part of is called Recovery - Randomised Evaluation of Covid-19 Therapy. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Bitamina ba talaga ang Dexamethasone? MALI! Hindi mapipigilan ng Dexamethasone na magkaroon ng COVID-19 ang mga tao! MARIING pinapaalala ng Food and Drug Administration (FDA) sa publiko na ang Dexamethasone ay isang gamot na kailangan ng reseta at dapat gamitin sa ilalim ng mahigpit na pagbabantay ng isang lisensiyadong doktor. Ito’y matapos ibulgar ng isang netizen na ibinebenta ang Dexamethasone bilang over-the-counter medication sa isang online shopping platform. Matapos makakuha ng maraming retweet, sinabi ng kompanya na ialis na ang nasabing produkto. "Lalo pa kaming magsisikap na matigil ng pagkalat ng maling impormasyon sa aming platform," sabi ng kompanya sa isang tweet. Biglang nakilala ang Dexamethasone nang tawagin itong "life-saving" na gamot matapos nitong bawasan bilang ng mga namamatay na pasyente na may ventilator ng ikatlong bahagi habang ikalimang bahagi naman ang nabawas sa mga pasyenteng may oxygen. Dahil dito, ang resulta ng mga pag-aaral ay masusing binabantayan ng mga eksperto bilang bahagi ng clinical trials ukol sa posibleng gamot sa COVID-19. Itinuturing itong mapanganib dahil sa simula sa pandemic, karamihan sa pandaigdigang panuntunan ay pinagbabawal ang paggamit ng steroids para sa Covid-19. Gimamit ang steroids sa outbreaks ng dalawa pang mapanganib na coronaviruses – ang Sars at Mers – ngunit magkaiba ang naging resulta. Ang pag-aaral kung saan bahagi ang Dexamethasone ay tintawag na Recovery-Randomised Evaluation of Covid-19 Therapy. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 FLIPCHECK: FLIP FLOP! Full reversal of statement. Based on previous statements and actions, it appears that the President's intentions were clear in railroading the passage of the Anti-Terrorism Bill. Also false is Presidential Spokesperson Harry Roque's statement that it makes no difference as the bill has already been filed last 17th congress but just delayed by the House of Representatives. “Naipasa na po iyan ng Senado noong isang Kongreso pa, 17th Congress pa, naantala nga lang sa Kamara at ngayon po, apat na buwan nang naipasa ng Senado iyang panukalang batas na iyan bago na-certify as urgent," said Roque last June 13, 2020 in an interview with Rowena Salvacion. The bill was in fact stuck at second reading until the 17th congress adjourned on June 17, 2019. Sotto even said that the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2019 was left behind due to the lack of time. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 FLIPCHECK: FLIP FLOP! Full reversal of statement. Batay sa nakalipas niyang pahayag at pagkilos, malinaw ang intensiyon ng Pangulo na madaliin ang pagpasa ng Anti-Terrorism Bill. Mali rin ang pahayag ni Presidential Spokesperson Harry Roque na wala itong pagkakaiva dahil ang panukala ay inihain noon pang 17th congress at naantala lang sa House of Representatives. “Naipasa na po iyan ng Senado noong isang Kongreso pa, 17th Congress pa, naantala nga lang sa Kamara at ngayon po, apat na buwan nang naipasa ng Senado iyang panukalang batas na iyan bago sinertipikahan bilang urgent," wika ni Roque noong ika-13 ng Hunyo sa panayam ni Rowena Salvacion. Naipit nga ang panukala sa ikalawang pagbasa hanggang natapos ang 17th Congress noong ika-17 ng Hunyo, 2019. Sinabi pa ni Sotto na naiwan ang Anti-Terrorism Act of 2019 dahil naubusan na ng panahon. text: Is the Fabunan Antiviral Injection (FAI) really a total cure for COVID-19 just because it contains dexamethasone or procaine? False, there are not enough (not a single) clinical studies or evidence/s that FAI can cure. All it has are correlational pieces of evidence on its components and not a structured scientific study on the effectiveness of the FAI as a whole. Take note that clinical testing has four (4) phases to ensure its safety and effectiveness. It is completely different to cite correlational scientific literature to justify the effectiveness of each individual ingredient from a complete scientific study and clinical test that proves effectiveness and safety of the mixture of this injection. According to FAI Facebook Page, an unofficial Facebook page managed by Fabunan Medical Clinic supporters, they posted that the drug is a total cure amid the breakthrough findings from UK clinical trials. The FAI is a U.S patented drug formula by Dr. Ruben Fabunan and described as therapeutic formulation as a treatment for various viral diseases like Influenza and Dengue Fever. Its components are Procaine hydrochloride, local anesthetic, and a water-soluble glucocorticoid, dexamethasone sodium phosphate. Up until now, the FAI has failed to comply with the necessary documentation and protocol that the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) requires to mark it as safe and effective. The FDA has already issued a Cease and Desist Order on the clinic as well. Dexamethasone, on the other hand, has now gotten a lot of attention after the results of the trials were released. The drug cuts the mortality of patients by a third for those who are in ventilators and by a fifth on those who are in oxygen. The drug appears to help high-risk patients. In addition, the drug does not help people who have mild symptoms thus it is not recommended to buy and pile stocks of it. Procaine is just an anesthetic used to reduce pain on injections. The FDA reminded the public that dexamethasone is only a prescription drug used under the supervision of a licensed physician. This is why the Dexamethasone study indicated that it only worked on COVID-19 patients who are at high risk of mortality (ventilator and oxygen). Misuse or self-medication of dexamethasone can cause adverse reactions to your body like Cushing's Syndrome. [1] Facebook Post (https://www.facebook.com/108027014182453/posts/151130406538780/?app=fbl) [2] Ni, Y., Chen, G., Sun, J. et al. The effect of corticosteroids on mortality of patients with influenza pneumonia: a systematic review and meta-analysis. Crit Care 23, 99 (2019). (https://doi.org/10.1186s13054-019-2395-8) [3] FDA Advisory [4] Yu WC, Hui DSC, Chan-Yeung M, Antiviral agents and corticosteroids in the treatment of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) Thorax2004;59:643-645. Ang Fabunan Antiviral Injection (FAI) ba ang gamot sa COVID-19 dahil mayroon itong dexamethasone o procaine? Mali, hindi sapat ang isinagawang clinical studies (kahit isa wala) o mga ebidensiya na makakagaling nga ang FAI. Ang tanging mayroon ito ay magkakaugnay na piraso ng ebidensiya ukol sa nilalalaman nito at hindi matibay na pag-aaral na batay sa siyensiya ukol sa bisa ng FAI sa kabuuan. Pansinin na ang isang clinical testing ay may apat na bahagi para matiyak na ito’y ligtas at mabisa. Ayon sa Facebook Page ng FAI, nag-post sila na ang gamot ay solusyon sa gitna ng bagong natuklasan sa clinical trials na ginagawa sa UK. Ang FAI ay isang U.S patented drug formula ni Dr. Ruben Fabunan at inilarawan bilang therapeutic formulation at gamot sa iba’t ibang viral diseases tulad ng Influenza at Dengue Fever. Naglalaman ito ng Procaine hydrochloride, local anesthetic, at glucocorticoid na maaring ihalo sa tubig, at dexamethasone sodium phosphate. Hanggang ngayon, bigo ang FAI na sumunod sa mga dokumentasyon at protocol na kailangan ng Food and Drug Administration (FDA) para ideklara itong ligtas at mabisa. Naglabas na rin ang FDA Cease and Desist Order sa klinika ng FAI. Nakakakuha naman ng atensiyon ang Dexamethasone matapos lumabas ang resulta ng clinical trials. Binawasan ng gamot ang bilang ng mga namamatay na pasyente na may ventilator ng ikatlong bahagi habang ikalimang bahagi naman ang nabawas sa mga pasyenteng may oxygen. Sa pagsusuri, nakatutulong ng gamot sa mga pasyenteng lubhang mapanganib ang lagay. Dagdag pa rito, hindi nakatutulong ang gamot sa mga taong may mababang sintomas kaya hindi inirerekomenda na bumili at mag-ipon nito. Ang procaine naman ay isang uri ng pampamanhid na ginagamit upang bawasan ang sakit na dulot ng iniksiyon. Pinaalalahanan ng FDA ang publiko na ang dexamethasone ay isang prescription drug na ginagamit sa pahintulot ng isang lisensiyadong doctor. Kaya nakalagay sa pag-aaral ukol sa Dexamethasone na ito’y may bisa lang sa mga pasyenteng may COVID-19 na malubha ang kalagayan (nakakabit sa ventilator at oxygen). Ang maling paggamit at self-medication ng dexamethasone ay maaaring humantong sa hindi magandang reaksiyon ng katawan, tulad ng Cushing's Syndrome.

text: UPDATE: Caving into criticism, PNP scraps Chinese help desks - Rappler at 3:48 PM, Today 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Are the photos of PNP Chinese help desks real? TRUE! PNP spokesman Brig. Gen. Bernard Banac earlier said that they planned to set up these help desks in the offices of Criminal Investigation and Detection Group (CIDG) and Anti-Kidnapping Group (PNP-AKG) in the advent of rising crimes committed by Chinese citizens. The PNP-AKG in August last year said it would send some of its cops to China for a month to learn Mandarin. According to Interaksyon, these desks will be manned by 16 policemen with 12-hour shifts. Funds for this strategy, including Mandarin lessons for the assigned police, will come from PNP’s budget. Although in an earlier interview, Banac said that sponsors for police trainings are welcome. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Totoo ba ang mga larawan ng PNP Chinese Help Desks? TOTOO! Sinabi na noon ni PNP spokesman Brig. Gen. Bernard Banac na plano nilang maglagay ng help desks sa mga tanggapan ng Criminal Investigation and Detection Group (CIDG) at Anti-Kidnapping Group (PNP-AKG) bunsod ng tumataas na bilang ng krimen laban sa mga mamamayan ng China. Sinabi pa ng PNP-AKG noong Agosto ng nakaraang taon na magpapadala sila ng ilang pulis sa China sa loob ng isang buwan para matuto ng Mandarin. Ayon sa Interaksyon, ang mga desk na ito ay tatauhan ng 16 pulis na may 12 oras na shift. Ang pondo sa pagkilos na ito, kabilang ang pag-aaral ng Mandarin ng mga nakatalagang pulis, ay galing sa pondo ng PNP. Subalit sa naunang panayam, sinabi ni Banac na tumatanggap sila ng sponsor para sa training ng mga pulis. SOURCES: This request was submitted by a community fact-checker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did the Grand Mañanita protesters in UPD really not practice social distancing? FALSE, according to the reporter who posted the photo being weaponized by Asianpolicy(.)press to attack the dissenters. We enjoin you to not visit their website as it is an ad-farm. Your presence nad clicks adds money to their purses. GMA-7 Journalist Sandra Aguinaldo had succeeding tweets that showed how the protesters were practicing social distancing. Aguinaldo even retweeted the GMA-7 article that claimed that the protest did indeed practice social distancing. A live video stream was also done by Aguinaldo during the protest in which she specifically said that protesters were practicing social distancing. Sandra Aguinaldo even got into an online fight with a netizen because of the photo. The netizen noted that pro-administration groups are weaponizing that photo in which she responded to simply see all of her tweets during the same day to see how she noted the social distancing done by protesters. The netizen has since deleted that tweet and apologized with Aguinaldo accepting the apology. There's a photo, video, and drone footage to say that Asianpolicy(.)press is fake news. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Hindi ba nagkaroon ng social distancing sa Grand Mañanita rally sa UPD? MALI, ayon sa reporter na nag-post ng larawan na ginagamit ng Asianpolicy(.)press para batikusin ang mga kumokontra sa pamahalaan. Hinihikayat namin kayo na huwag bisitahin ang kanilang website dahil ito’y isang ad-farm. Ang inyong pagbisita at click ay nagdadagdag ng pera sa kanilang mga bulsa. May mga kasunod pang tweet si GMA-7 Journalist Sandra Aguinaldo na nagpapakita na may social distancing sa mga raliyista. Ni-retweet pa ni Aguinaldo ang istorya ng GMA-7 na nagsasabing may social distancing sa nasabing protesta. Isang live video stream din ang ginawa ni Aguinaldo habang isinasagawa ang protesta kung saan sinabi niya na sumunod ang mga raliyista sa social distancing. Napaaway pa sa online si Sandra Aguinaldo sa isang netizen dahil sa laawan. Napansin ng netizen na ginagamit ng mga grupong kampi sa administrasyon kung saan sinabi niya na tingnan ang lahat ng kanyang tweets sa nasabing araw kung saan binanggit niya na mayroong social distancing sa nasabing rally. Binura na ng netizen ang kanyang tweet at humingi ng paumanhin na tinanggap naman ni Aguinaldo. Mayroong larawan, video, at footage mula sa drone na nagpapatunay na fake news ang Asianpolicy(.)press. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Was Danding Cojuangco a "dilawan" and not a Marcos crony as claimed by Marcos Loyalists? False, according to political party records and supreme court decisions. Crony capitalism in the Philippines is characterized by the business operations of Marcos’ close friends and collaborators, sustained by generous government loans and guarantees, and bailed out with state funds when they mismanaged themselves into financial trouble. It was no secret that Danding Cojuangco was loyal to Ferdinand Marcos Sr. seeing that when the disagreements between the Cojuangco branches came to a head in a 1965 Congressional match, pitting first cousins against each other in Tarlac’s First District, Danding allied himself with Marcos' Nacionalista Party while Peping was proclaimed by Macapagal as the Liberal Party candidate. Danding would soon learn that his alliance would make him richer. Danding Cojuangco was also part of the "Rolex-12", the people responsible for planning and implementing Martial Law. Alfred W. Mccoy, author of An Anarchy of Families: State and Family in the Philippines, even described Danding Cojuangco as former President Corazon Aquino's rival and blood enemy even if they were blood cousins. This bitter feud started in January 1963 when Danding and his cousin Monching agreed to vote their uncle Don Juan as the new president of the family-owned Philippine Bank of Commerce, replacing their uncle Don Pepe, Cory and Peping's father and long considered the patriarch of the enterprise who is credited for having pulled the bank out of the ashes of World War II. Aquino also did not support Danding Cojuangco's bid for the presidency. Instead, she opted to support Fidel V. Ramos. She also supported her brother, Peping, when he ran against Danding. Danding Cojuangco and Imelda Marcos greeted each other while smiling and holding hands during the 40th wedding anniversary of Miriam and Narciso Santiago back in 2011. According to Ricardo Manapat, author of 'Some are smarter than others: the history of Marcos' crony capitalism', when the tax was raised for liquor and cigarettes in 1986, the excise tax for beer was lowered. San Miguel Corporations saved an estimated $40 million. The Supreme court and Sandiganbayan completely acknowledge the fact that Danding was a crony of Marcos for having the permission and power to use the Coco Levy Fund to buy 72.2% of United Coconut Planters Bank (UCPB) and 51% of San Miguel Corporation (SMC). 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 “Dilawan” nga ba si Danding Cojuangco at hindi crony ni Marcos gaya ng sinasabi ng Marcos Loyalists? Mali, ayon sa record ng mga partido pulitikal at desisyon ng Korte Suprema. Ang tinatawag na crony capitalism sa Pilipinas ay operasyon ng mga negosyo ng mga malapit na kaibigan at mga kasabwat ni Marcos, na sinusuportahan ng mga pautang at garantiya ng pamahalaan, at inililigtas ng pondo ng gobyerno kapag ito’y hindi napatakbo nang tama at nagkaproblema sa pondo. Hindi lihim na tapat si Danding Cojuangco kay Ferdinand Marcos Sr. kung saan nang magkaroon ng di pagkakasundo ang mga Cojuangco noong 1965 Congressional election, kung saan naglaban ang magpinsang buo sa Unang Distrito ng Tarlac, umalyado si Danding sa Nacionalista Party ni Marcos habang si Peping ay iprinoklama ni Macapagal bilang pambato ngLiberal Party. Nabatid din kinalaunan ni Danding na yayaman siya sa kkanyang pakikipag-alyansa kay Marcos. Bahagi rin si Danding Cojuangco ng "Rolex-12", ang mga taong nasa likod ng pagpaplano at pagpapatupad ng Martial Law. Inilarawan pa ni Alfred W. Mccoy, ang nagsulat ng An Anarchy of Families: State and Family in the Philippines, si Danding Cojuangco bilang dating karibal at katunggali ni dating Pangulong Corazon Aquino kahit pa sila’y magpinsan sa dugo. Ang away na ito ay nagsimula noong Enero 1963 nang pumayag sina Danding at kanyang pinsan na si Monching na iboto ang kanilang tiyuhin na si Don Juan bilang bagong pangulo ng Philippine Bank of Commerce na pag-aari ng pamilya, bilang kapalit ng isa pa nilang tiyuhin na si Don Pepe, ama nina Cory at Peping at itinuturing na siyang puno ng kanilang negosyo at siyang nagbangon sa bangko mula sa mga abo ng World War II. Hindi rin sinuportahan ni Aquino ang pagtakbo ni Danding Cojuangco bilang pangulo. Sa halip, sinuportahan niya si Fidel V. Ramos. Sinuportahan din niya ang kapatid na si Peping nang tumakbo ito laban kay Danding. Nagbatian din sina Danding Cojuangco at Imelda Marcos habang nakangiti at magkahawak ng kamay sa ika-40 taong anibersaryo ng kasal nina Miriam at Narciso Santiago noong 2011. Ayon kay Ricardo Manapat, may akda ng 'Some are smarter than others: the history of Marcos' crony capitalism', nang itinaas ang buwis sa alak at sigarilyo noong 1986, ang excise tax sa beer ay binaba kaya nakatipid ang San Miguel Corporations ng tinatayang $40 milyon. Kinilala rin ng Korte Suprema at Sandiganbayan si Danding bilang crony ni Marcos dahil mayroon siyang permiso at kapangyarihan na gamitin ang Coco Levy Fund para bilhin ang 72.2 porsiyento ng United Coconut Planters Bank (UCPB) at 51 porsiyento ng San Miguel Corporation (SMC). -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: Ricardo., Manapat (1991). Some are smarter than others : the history of Marcos' crony capitalism. New York: Aletheia Publications. ISBN 9719128704. OCLC 28428684. -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: This fake news quote is circulating again! Context: "Tutol ako sa Death Penalty kahit rapin at patayin pa ang aking anak na babae." is a fake and vile statement being attributed to Atty. Chel Diokno. It was first circulated by pro-administration networks during the 2019 elections particularly after ABS-CBN's Harapan 2019 Senatorial Debate. Diokno was asked during the debate that if his child were raped or killed, should the criminal be given the death penalty to which Diokno replied: "Tutol na tutol po ako sa death penalty dahil anti-poor po ang death penalty. It is not the severity of the punishment but the certainty that stops the crime." The Free Legal Assistance Group (FLAG), to which Diokno is part of, conducted a death row survey back in 2004 which found that “the profile of death row is the profile of the poor in Philippine society: largely uneducated, largely unemployed and generally living in poverty.” In the case of People of the Philippines v Mateo (2004), the Supreme Court admitted that a vast majority of trial courts had wrongfully imposed the death penalty by 71.77% from 1993 to 2004. Fact Check Philippines March 7, 2019 at 4:36 PM · Rating: False This misinformation is not only below the belt as it did not spare the family of a senatorial candidate from deception but Laya Diokno is also very clear about supporting her dad by going to his sorties and representing him in events. #FactCheckPH -\-\- 6/19/2020 Update This fake news quote is circulating again! Context: "Tutol ako sa Death Penalty kahit rapin at patayin pa ang aking anak na babae." is a fake and vile statement being attributed to Atty. Chel Diokno. It was first circulated by pro-administration networks during the 2019 elections particularly after ABS-CBN's Harapan 2019 Senatorial Debate. Diokno was asked during the debate that if his child were raped or killed, should the criminal be given the death penalty to which Diokno replied: "Tutol na tutol po ako sa death penalty dahil anti-poor po ang death penalty. It is not the severity of the punishment but the certainty that stops the crime." The Free Legal Assistance Group (FLAG), to which Diokno is part of, conducted a death row survey back in 2004 which found that “the profile of death row is the profile of the poor in Philippine society: largely uneducated, largely unemployed and generally living in poverty.” In the case of People of the Philippines v Mateo (2004), the Supreme Court admitted that a vast majority of trial courts had wrongfully imposed the death penalty by 71.77% from 1993 to 2004.

text: Does the President really support press freedom and free speech as claimed by Presidential Spokesperson Harry Roque? FLIP-FLOP! It's a full reversal from statements given or actions done by the President and his administration. For context, the last time journalists were banned from entering Malacañang was during the Marcos regime. Here are other statements that didn't make it to the card: *This is still not the full exhaustive list* *These are statements or actions that make it harder for journalists to do their job* “The vultures of journalism, ‘yan ang maraming namamatay. If you are a vulture of journalism, that’s not my problem," - Pres. Rodrigo Duterte to the media | June 2, 2016 "Press freedom, kayo 'yung number one magnanakaw, ayaw 'nyo isauli 'yung propiedad, press freedom." - Pres. Rodrigo Duterte to ABS-CBN | May 19, 2017 "Gusto mo subukin kung meron pa? May asawa ka? Pahiram mo sa akin." - President Duterte to Kit Tatad | February 14, 2019 "She's in every inch a prostitute." - Pres. Rodrigo Duterte on Ellen Tordesillas | May 13, 2019 "For your information, you can stop your suspicious mind from roaming somewhere else. But since you are a fake news outlet then I am not surprised that your articles are also fake." - Pres. Rodrigo Duterte to Rappler | January 16, 2018 Our friends from Explaination made an infographic last February about the five (5) instruments of media control that several administrations have employed from the Americans to Pres. Duterte : SOURCES:

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did Kadamay really call for regular salaries for protesters? FALSE based on a reverse-image search and a cursory search. This piece of disinformation aims to delegitimize the calls and advocacies of leftist groups such as Kadamay and also smear the reputation of the two remaining opposition Senators. By its definition, disinformation is political with the goal of either helping or destroying a particular agenda. We have also published a post before wherein we debunked the disinformation or fake news that claimed that Kadamay Chairperson Bea Arrellano was demanding for a house with free WiFi internet connection. This manipulated photo first appeared in 2017 when it was posted by VOVPH, another fake news page, in an album where the page made fun of the Kadamay's protests during Labor Day of that same year. It was Ron Lopez, via DZMM Teleradyo's twitter, who first posted the photo during his live coverage of the Labor Day protests back in 2017. This manipulated image also did not appear in other media organizations based on a cursory search. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Nanawagan ba talaga ang Kadamay para sa regular na suweldo para sa mga nagpo-protesta? MALI, batay sa tinatawag na reverse-image search at mabilisang pagsasaliksik. Layunin ng maling imporasyon na ito na pahinain ang panawagan at adbokasiya ng mga makakaliwang grupo tulad ng Kadamay at sirain ang reputasyon ng dalawang natitirang Senador na kabilang sa oposisyon. Sa kahulugan nito, ang tinatawag na “disinformation” ay pagkilos na may kinalaman sa pulitika na ang layunin ay tulungan o sirain ang isang partikular na agenda. Naglabas na rin tayo ng post noon kung saan binasag natin ang maling impormasyon o fake news na nagsasabing humihingi si Kadamay Chairperson Bea Arrellano ng bahay na may libreng WiFi internet connection. Ang minanipulang larawan ay unang lumabas noong 2017 nang i-post ito ng VOVPH, na kilala bilang fake news page, sa isang album kung saan ginawang katatawanan ang mga protesta ng Kadamay noong Labor Day sa parehong taon. Si Ron Lopez, sa pamamagitan ng Twitter ng DZMM Teleradyo, ang unang naglabas ng nasabing larawan sa kanyang ginawang live coverage ng protesta na kaugnay ng Labor Day noong 2017. Ang pinekeng lawaran ay hindi rin lumabas sa iba pang media organizations batay sa pagsasaliksik. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did the media really stay silent on the issue of press freedom when former Pres. Cory Aquino filed a libel suit against journalist Luis Beltran as claimed by Gilbert Remulla? FALSE, according to an article written by former UP College of Mass Communication Dean Luis Teodoro back in 2003 and the Index Censorship's The Press And Human Rights In The Philippines Issue published in February 1990. Last Monday, June 15, 2020, former journalist and House representative Gilbert Remulla tweeted. "When Cory Aquino, as president, successfully sued Louie Beltran for libel, I don’t recall anyone in the media calling it the “death of press freedom” or the “death of democracy”. " Remulla claimed that this was due to the fact that "she was an Aquino." His claim that the media stayed silent is false. Teodoro's first sentence in his 2003 article was "In 1987, a libel suit filed by then President Corazon Aquino against Philippine Star columnist Luis Beltran alarmed press freedom groups." Clearly, this established the fact Aquino's decision to sue Beltran didn't sit well with the media. The Index on Censorship also called the libel as having a chilling effect specifically citing Corazon Aquino's suit against Beltran and Philippine Star Editor Max Soliven. Another cited example as an attack against the press was Tingting Cojuanco's libel suit against another journalist. Several journalists like Danilo Arao, Beltran's student in UP, and Inday Espina Varona refuted the claim with Varona saying that Remulla should go to the National Library which has records of what journalists really said back then. Aquino initially won the case but was then reversed by the Court of Appeals. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 If you are somebody who is selling through Lazada, Shoppee, Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram then you must read this post.. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did Atty. Chel Diokno really say this statement about freedom and President Duterte? FALSE! A cursory search of keywords from Diokno's alleged statement in search engines and social media sites yielded no records of it. A social media sweep on his social media platforms also showed no records of the statement. This fake quote made by a certain Facebook user Pauline O'Mhar was first uploaded to a Facebook group named "Senator Imee Marcos Supporters" and was shared to "Good News Duterte" Facebook group by Charie Fronda and then shared again to "MAGHISGOT KITA'G POLITIKA SA SUGBO, BAY !!!" Facebook group by Antonio Tan Jr. The fake post now has a total interaction (reactions and comments) of 3,439 across 3 groups. Please report the link below. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Sinabi ba talaga ni Atty. Chel Diokno ang pahayag na ito ukol sa kalayaan at kay Pangulong Duterte? MALI! Sa pagsasaliksik gamit ang keywords mula sa umano'y pahayag ni Diokno sa iba't ibang search engines at social media sites, walang lumabas na anumang record ukol dito. Nang tingnan naman ang kanyang social media platforms, wala ring recoed ukol sa nasabing pahayag. Ang pekeng pahayag na ginawa ng Facebook user na si Pauline O'Mhar ay unang na-upload sa Facebook group na may pangalang "Senator Imee Marcos Supporters" at na-share sa "Good News Duterte" Facebook group ni Charie Fronda at muling na-share sa Facebook group na "MAGHISGOT KITA'G POLITIKA SA SUGBO, BAY !!!" ng isang Antonio Tan Jr. Ang pekeng post ay nakakalap na ng kabuuang 3,439 interaksiyon (reaksiyon at komento) sa tatlong grupo. Paki-report ang link sa ibaba. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ Report: SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Is the news about the Department of Agriculture (DA) asking poultry raisers to limit production to give way to imports true or false? TRUE, according to the Department of Agriculture's Bureau of Animal Industry (BAI) statement during the virtual meeting with local producers, "requesting" them to "self-regulate." This was said after the producers asked BAI to stop the importation of poultry products because of the worsening farmgate prices due to oversupply that will cause losses to farmers. This statement garnered negative reactions from the Senate and key industry players. In his statement, Senate President Pro Tempore Ralph Recto rejected DA's plan to increase poultry imports. "All of the three projections point to a surplus. If such is the case, why encourage imports? Kung 135 percent hanggang 183 percent ang chicken sufficiency forecast, bakit mag-aangkat pa?" Recto said. Agriculture Secretary William Dar denied the harm of imports and said that these imports will not compete with the local market supply since these are used for processing. BAI Director Ronnie Domingo justified the oversupply with lower demand due to the government's policy of community quarantine since March. The United Broilers and Raisers' Association (UBRA), supported by the Philippine Chamber of Agriculture and Food Inc (PCAFI), sent an open letter to Secretary Dar rejecting the claim that imports are too "minimal" to hurt Filipino producers. "In the kindest possible terms, this is one of the most bizarre thinking that ever emanated from the DA," said UBRA President Elias Jose Inciong. The Agriculture Department has promised to provide more cold storage facilities for poultry supplies. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Totoo ba o hindi ang balita ukol sa hiling ng Department of Agriculture (CA) sa poultry raisers na limitahan ang produksiyon para bigyang daan ang mga imported na produkto? TOTOO, ayon sa pahayag ng Bureau of Animal Industry (BAI) ng Department of Agriculture sa isang virtual meeting kasama ang mga lokal na producers, kung saan hiniling nito sa kanila na mag-“self-regulate." Ito ay nabanggit matapos hilingin ng mga producer sa BAI na itigil ang importasyon ng poultry products dahil sa bumababang presyo sa farmgate dahil sa sobrang supply na hahantong sa pagkalugi ng mga magsasaka. Ang pahayag na ito ng BAI ay umani ng batikos mula sa Senado at iba pang kabilang sa industriya. Sa kanyang pahayag, ibinasura ni Senate President Pro Tempore Ralph Recto ang plano ng DA na dagdagan ang pag-aangkat ng manok. "Lahat ng tatlong pagtaya ay nakaturo sa posibleng sobra sa supply. Kung ito ang sitwasyon, bakit mo isusulong ang pag-aangkat? Kung 135 percent hanggang 183 percent ang pagtaya sa kasapatan ng supply ng manok, bakit mag-aangkat pa?" sabi ni Recto. Itinanggi naman ni Agriculture Secretary William Dar na makakasama ang pag-aangkat dahil ang mga ito’y hindi makikipagkumpitensiya sa lokal na merkado dahil ito’y ginagamit sa food processing. Binigyang katwiran naman ni BAI Director Ronnie Domingo ang sinasabing oversupply na itinuro niya sa mababang demand bunsod ng community quarantine mula noong Marso. Naglabas naman ang United Broilers and Raisers' Association (UBRA), na suportado ng Philippine Chamber of Agriculture and Food Inc (PCAFI), ng bukas na liham kay Secretary Dar na itinatanggi ang pahayag nito na “maliit” lang ang epekto ng pag-aangkat sa lokal na producer. "Sa pinakamabait na posibleng termino, ito ang isa sa pinaka-kakaibang pag-iisip na tinuran ng DA," wika ni UBRA President Elias Jose Inciong. Nangako naman ang Agriculture Department na maglalaan ng mas maraming cold storage facilities para sa mga supply ng manok. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: Ilag Veh! / Watch Out! This was the warning of Senate President Vicente “Tito” Sotto III on Wednesday who warned critics of disrespecting the president. This veiled warning comes after he claims that several netizens are urging the Office of the President to veto the Anti Terrorism Bill. This veiled warning is different from the statement of Sotto last June 3, 2020 about his claim the people can keep on cursing the government all-day and the government won't still oppose them. According to an Interaksyon article written Jeline Malasig, The anti-terror bill includes a provision that “advocacy, protest, dissent, stoppage of work, industrial or mass action and other similar exercises of civil and political rights” shall not be considered as “terrorism.” However, the same section says that it only applies if those activities “are not intended to cause death or serious physical harm to a person, to endanger a person’s life, or to create a serious risk to public safety.” The Anti-Terrorism bill has also removed provisions from the original Human Security Act that penalizes law enforcement authorities for wrongful imprisonment. In 2010, Farmer Edgar Candule, a member of an Aeta community in Botolan, Zambales, was arrested on March 21, 2008 on suspicion of being a member of the communist New People's Army (NPA). He was charged with illegal possession of firearms and violation of Republic Act 9372, also known as the Human Security Act (HSA). Candule was eventually acquitted and released from detention on November 10, 2010 It was an ordeal that would make him P480.5 million richer. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 SOURCES: This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: Did VP Leni really say this statement about Anti Terrorism Bill? PARTLY FALSE! This material has been rated PARTLY FALSE because it had the intention to mislead the audience by removing it from the original context of the discussion of the Anti-Terrorism Bill in Biserbisyong Leni last June 7, 2020. (FULL TRANSCRIPT BELOW) This misleading post falls into the same category of disinformation that paints the Vice President as unqualified for saying ridiculous things that are fake. Ironically, people are believing it and calling her bobo or dumb in the comments section. The quote that was taken out of context had earlier connecting statements wherein VP Leni talked about the congressional rail-roading wherein a number of congressmen withdrew their votes because the bill would not be up for amendments anymore or would not go for a bicameral conference where experts are commonly invited to talk about the subject matter. A bill usually undergoes bicameral conference in order to settle the differences of the Senate version and the House version of the bill. In this case, the house of Representatives decided to adopt the Senate version of the bill to fast track it. President Rodrigo Duterte certified the bill as urgent last June 1, 2020, during the start of the General Community Quarantine for the COVID-19 pandemic. Here is the transcript from 43:13-46:18 of BISERBISYONG LENI | June 7, 2020: Ely Saludar: Sa gitna ng patuloy na pagtutok natin sa COVID-19 pandemic, eto marami talagang nagulat din dito sa Anti-Terror Bill. VP Leni: Diyusko naman nakapanlulumo Ka Ely kasi dumadaan tayo sa trahedyang pinakamalaki sa history ng di ba, iyong health crisis na pinagdadaanan ngayon, hindi pa tayo dumaan sa ganito. Parang iyong huli yata, iyong Spanish Flu pero mas grabe ito. Dahil napakahirap nito, dapat sana all hands on deck. Dapat sana lahat naka-focus sa problema tapos isisingit pa itong Anti-Terror Bill. Para sa akin Ka Ely, Bakit? Hindi lang ito sinisingit pero pinipilit. Bakit natin nasasabing pinipilit? Nakita natin Ka Ely iyong statement nung mga authors sa House of Representatives na binawi iyong kanilang pagiging author. Ano ang dahilan nila? Ang dahilan nila kasi ayaw nang mag-accept ng amendments. Iyong iba’t ibang boses iyon iyong essence ng demokrasya. Ang gusto nila Ka Ely i-adopt na lang iyong Senate version kasi minamadali nga para huwag nang mag-bicam. Pero parang binawian niyo ng boses iyong mamamayan. Eto Ka Ely, alam ko itong Anti-Terror Bill parang 2017 pa ito finile dahil doon sa Marawi, but iyong sa House of Representatives nag-invite ng mga experts, nag-invite ng mga resource persons. Parang nung ni-railroad sa floor, parang all of a sudden wala nang saysay iyong inputs nila. So ang tanong bakit? Tapos pag binasa mo iyong batas, eto isang buong Biserbisyo yata ito Ka Ely, pero pag binasa mo iyong batas ang daming nakakatakot na provisions. Iyong nilawakan nila iyong definition ng terrorism, nakakatakot iyon. Kasi pag nakakatakot na provision Ka Ely, kasi doon sa Human Security Act na kinukuwestiyon na natin noong 2007, mayroon doong isang provision kung saan pini-penalize iyong law enforcement officers na wrongfully nag-arrest na bawat araw ng arrest P500,000. Inalis iyon Ka Ely, gustong sabihin wala nang takot kahit mang-aresto nang mang-aresto kahit walang basis. Ka Ely: Kung sinong makursunadahan puwede. VP Leni: Talagang grabe iyong… Ka Ely: Wala silang pananagutan ma’am…. VP Leni: Walang pananagutan, Grabe iyong spaces for abuse kaya eto Ka Ely, mariin natin itong kinokontra. Ang hinihingi natin, hindi natin binabawalan na magpasa ng batas kung palagay nila hindi pa sufficient ito, pero sa tama naman na proseso.Walang railroading kasi pag niri-railroad, bakit? Nakakatakot. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 SOURCES: This request was submitted by a community fact-checker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Is the Coronavirus just a cover-up for an out of control chemical agent manufactured by China? FALSE, according to basic Chemistry and Biology. Just as scientists are getting tired of explaining as to why the coronavirus is not a man-made virus, a new piece of misinformation surfaces. The claim of this misinformation is that the coronavirus is not real but rather an out of control chemical agent manufactured by China in order to control the protestors in Hong Kong. This video was posted by a Facebook page named Bisaya Kay Ka, but it was first uploaded by a YouTube Channel called "Boy Sayote". Ironically, the narrator called it a conspiracy theory but proceeded to give it space on the internet for virality by making a video out of it and asking people in the end if they think it's true or not. The video failed to contrast it with basic facts as to what separates chemicals from a microbial organism and other claims in it. Clearly, the video falls apart when you know that a coronavirus is a pathogen and not a chemical. It falls more on the realm of Biology rather than chemistry. The video's premise was that the coronavirus is actually an out of control chemical agent being tested to Muslims' concentration camps in Xinjiang Province in China. While the chemical agent claim is false, the presence of concentration camps is true and reports of government organ harvesting and forced conversions are being looked into by human rights watchdogs. It is false to classify viruses as chemicals. They are infectious agents or pathogens. Chemical substances, on the other hand, are any material with definite chemical composition. It can either be chemical elements, compounds, and mixtures. Other false claims made by the video: 1. Falsified reports on deaths to be classified as COVID-19 instead of Chemical death - FALSE. The dead bodies had to be swabbed and tested for the presence of SAR-CoV-2. This relies on a PCR test which tests if the RNA (present in organisms) of SARS-CoV-2 is present. 2. Li Wenliang's death was planned - FALSE. He died due to complications of COVID-19. He was forced to make a public apology by the police for publishing a report in a "SARS-like" outbreak happening in Wuhan which the police dismissed only as a rumor. His death provoked grief and anger which made the hashtag #wewantfreedomofspeech trend before it was taken down by Chinese state censors. 3. There is a 100% fatality in the disease - FALSE. If that were true, all of our COVID-19 cases would have been dead and we would have 0 recoveries. 4. The disease can cause schizophrenia - No definitive evidence or study for this it can cause psychosocial stress. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Editor's Note: An earlier version of this post misclassified viruses as non-infectious agents or pathogens. They are infectious agents or pathogens as per our references. This was a typographical error given the thought of the paragraph was talking about Chemicals. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ PLEASE REPORT: SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. Loop us in on suspicious Facebook pages, groups, accounts, websites, articles, or photos in your network by sending us a message here or contacting us through factcheckphils@gmail.com

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Is the effect of Alaxan as a pain reliever really just in the mind as claimed by DJ Loonyo? FALSE, according to decades worth of biopharmacological studies that support the mechanism of action of Ibuprofen. Three strikes and you're out, DJ Loonyo. We really don't think he is qualified to give medical opinions if he's not citing sources and fully informing himself with the right scientific literature. Editor's Note: An earlier version of this post classified arachidonic acid as an enzyme. Arachidonic acid is not an enzyme. It is an intracellular messenger. The enzyme description was meant for COX-1 and COX-2. Together, they produce prostaglandins that tune the nociceptors to lower our body's pain threshold. SOURCES: This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did the 'Chinese invade Zambales, blow up mountains, kill farmers and seize Nickel into hi-tech weapons to sabotage the Philippine military and economy'? The headline is FALSE, but the context is just PARTLY FALSE. At the end of the article in koreanewsonline.blogspot.com, the supposed author of the blog post "Makisig Bayani" indicated that it was first published in PhilStar. Its original author, Jarius Bondoc, wrote the opinion article but with a completely different headline. Its original title was 'Chinese have ‘invaded’ Zambales mainland too' and published on July 22, 2013. Notice the single quotation mark in the headline for the word invaded. This blog post from koreanewsonline has been resurrected last May. It first entered social media circulation back in 2014 and then returned in 2016 and now this year, according to CrowdTangle. This article is partly false because while it is true that Chinese companies have solidified their presence in Zambales, the headline of koreanewsonline are heavily dramatized and misleading without verifying the source as Bondoc wrote it as an opinion column and correlated events such as the murder of an Infanta mayor, not farmers, and nickel to sabotage Philippine military and economy. These are established by Bondoc as matters of opinions and not facts. One thing that is true and backed by a study is that these Chinese firms are not being held properly accountable for their disastrous mining. Back in April 2011, Pacific Strategies and Assessments (PSA), a company supplying foreign embassies and corporations in Manila with intelligence and business climate reports, released a study titled “Exploitive Chinese Mining in the Philippines." These firms do not “deliver correct compensation for environmental damage and value of minerals extracted from devastated mining areas….Chinese mining companies have a reputation for poor adherence to environment standards, especially with regard to small-scale mining projects,” the PSA report said. Multiple adverse effects to health have also been reported by residents near the area. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 -\-\- SOURCES: This request was submitted by a community factchecker. Loop us in on suspicious Facebook pages, groups, accounts, websites, articles, or photos in your network by sending us a message here or contacting us through factcheckphils@gmail.com

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did Senator Risa Hontiveros really support Maute Group and called them courageous and resilient? Disinformation networks are bringing back dead fake news posts from the grave. This piece of fake news first appeared in July 2017 when the Maute Group was making an attempt to occupy Marawi City. It can be recalled that during that period that an outrageous conspiracy theory from disinformation networks also appeared. It accused Hontiveros and former senator Bam Aquino as funders of the Maute group. However, false and outrageous it sounded, those false news posts still garnered a massive amount of reach and engagement which meant that people might have believed it to be true. The senator's fake quote has no basis as it really did not result in any record of Hontiveros saying the fake statement. Veteran journalist Ed Lingao made a long post discussing this event as he talked about possible lesson in communications and media studies. He talked about one of his colleagues who initiated a long tirade against the senator during one of his programs. The colleague was reacting with full conviction against the alleged statement by Hontiveros in a television show. At the 43rd mark of the video, his researcher informed him that the senator has called out the statement and the photo for being fake news. That colleague was Erwin Tulfo. After hearing his researcher, Tulfo brushed it aside as a retraction but you can't really retract something that you never even said in the first place, right? It turned out that Tulfo was really reacting to this fake quote photo of Hontiveros' interview with Daniel Razon on UNTV, Hontiveros clearly branded the Maute Group as a terrorist group and what they were discussing was the constitutional definitions and difference between rebellion and invasion. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Sinusuportahan ba talaga ni Senador Risa Hontiveros ang Maute Group at tinawag pa silang matatapang at matitibay? Binubuhay na naman ng mga nagpapakalat ng maling impormasyon ang mga fake news na matagal nang nakabaon sa hukay. Itong fake news na ito ay unang lumabas noong Hulyo 2017 nang sinulang tangkain ng Maute Group na sakupin ang Marawi City. Maaalalang sa panahong iyon lumabas ang isang nakakagalit na conspiracy theory mula sa mga nagpapakalat ng maling impormasyon. Inakushan nito sina Hontiveros at dating senador Bam Aquino bilang mga nagpopondo sa Maute group. Kahit ito’y walang katotohanan, marami pa ring naabot ang nasabing fake news na ibig sabihin na maraming tao pa rin ang naniwala na ito’y totoo. Wala ring batayan ang fake quote na idinidikit sa senador dahil walang anumang record na nagpapakitang sinabi ni Hontiveros ang pekeng pahayag. Naglabas ang beteranong mamamahayag na si Ed Lingao ng mahabang post na tumatalakay sa nasabing pangyari at ang posibleng mga aral sa komunikasyon at media. Pinag-usapan niya ang isa sa mga kapwa niya mamamahayag na bumanat sa senadora sa isa sa kanyang mga programa. Sa kanyang reaksiyon, kumbinsido ang nasabing mamamahayag ukol sa umano’y sinabi ni Hontiveros sa isang panayam sa telebisyon. Sa ika-42 ng video, ipinabatid sa kanya ng kanyang researcher na binansagan na ng senador ang pahayag at larawan bilang fake news. Ang nasabing mamamahayag ay si Erwin Tulfo. Matapos marinig ang kanyang researcher, itinuring na lang ni Tulfo na retraction o pagbawi ang pahayag ni Hontiveros ngunit masasabi mo bang binawi ang isang pahayag na hindi mo naman sinabi? Napag-alaman na nag-react lang si Tulfo sa larawan na may pekeng pahayag ni Hontiveros. Sa panayam ni Daniel Razon sa ng UNTV sa senadora, binansagan ni Hontiveros ang Maute Group bilang teroristang grupo at ang kanilang tinalakay ay ang kaibahan ng rebelyon at pagsalakay sa ilalim ng Konstitusyon. SOURCES: Erwin Tulfo's Researcher pointing out that Risa Hontiveros called out the fake news : https://youtu.be/FlAS2kLTFl0?t=2363 This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Are reports of cloned Facebook accounts simply a 'glitch' as claimed by the National Bureau of Investigation? NO RATING - STILL UNDER INVESTIGATION, according to the social media giant and two other Philippine government bodies. In an interview with Teleradyo on Monday (June 8), National Bureau of Investigation's (NBI's) Cybercrime Division chief Victor Lorenzo said that a glitch is possible for duplicate accounts because of Facebook. "What we're looking at right now is that in all probability, this was just a glitch, because it's very hard to create an account on Facebook these days, especially if you're creating multiple accounts under one ID, one cellphone number, one location," he said in the interview. Fact Check Philippines reached out to Facebook for a statement regarding this matter. A spokesperson for the social media company gave the following statement: "We understand the concerns raised by our community in the Philippines. We're investigating reports of suspicious activity on our platform and taking action on any accounts that we find to be in violation of our policies. We encourage people to continue reporting any accounts they believe may be inauthentic." Both Facebook and the Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT) urge people to file reports in their respective support channels. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 ‘Glitch’ nga ba talaga ang mga ulat ng mga kinopyang Facebook accounts gaya ng sinabi ng National Bureau of Investigation? WALA PANG RATING – INIIMBESTIGAHAN PA, ayon sa social media giant at dalawa pang ahensiya ng gobyerno ng Pilipinas. Sa panayam ng Teleradyo noong Lunes (Hunyo 8), sinabi ni National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) Cybercrime Division chief Victor Lorenzo na posibleng “glitch” lang ng Facebook ang mga duplicate account. "Ang aming tinitingnan ngayon na posibleng ito’y glitch lang dahil ang hirap gumawa ng account sa Facebook ngayon, lalo na kung gagawa ka ng maraming account sa ilalim ng isang ID, isang cellphone number, at isang lokasyon,” sabi niya sa panayam. Nakipag-ugnayan ang Fact Check Philippines sa Facebook para sa isang pahayag ukol dito. Ibinigay naman ng spokesperson ng social media company ang pahayag na ito: "Naunawaan namin ang pangamba ng aming komunidad sa Pilipinas. Iniimbestigahan na namin ang mga ulat ng kaduda-dudang akbitidad sa aming platform at gumagawa ng karampatang aksiyon sa mga account na makikita naming lumalabag sa aming mga patakaran. Hinihikayat namin ang publiko na patuloy na i-report ang mga account na pinaniniwalaan nilang hindi totoo." Kapwa hinikayat ng Facebook at ng Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT) ang taumbayan na maghain ng report sa kani-kanilang support channels. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community fact-checker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Can "suob" or steam therapy cure COVID-19? FALSE, according to the World Health Organization and the Department of Health. In our previous fact check regarding Aspirin, we clarified that there was no approved cure or treatment that directly targeted SARS-CoV-2, the virus responsible for COVID-19. The same is still true on this method. According to the Reagan-Udall Foundation, all treatments for COVID-19 are supportive in order to manage the symptoms and sickness. The WHO has previously busted the myth that flushing saline or salt water solution into your nose will prevent you from acquiring COVID-19. Suob relies on the steam of salt water. They also acknowledged the fact that while traditional and herbal medicines may help in alleviating symptoms or conditions brought about by COVID-19, there is still no cure or treatment that directly targets the virus. Steam therapy is a common household method to clear nasal passages. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Magagamot ba ng "suob" o steam therapy ang COVID-19? MALI, ayon sa World Health Organization at Department of Health. Sa ating mga nakalipas na fact check ukol sa Aspirin, nilinaw natin na wala pang aprubadong gamot o solusyon na direktang tumatarget sa SARS-CoV-2, ang virus na dahilan ng COVID-19. Ito rin ang katotohanan sa ganitong pamamaraan. Ayon sa Reagan-Udall Foundation, lahat ng uri ng paggamot para sa COVID-19 ay pawang pangsuporta lang upang makontrol ang sintomas at sakit. Una nang binasag ng WHO ang kuwento na ang pagpasok ng saline o salt water solution sa ilong ay makatutulong para hindi mahawaan ng COVID-19. Ang suob ay umaasa sa usok mula sa tubig na may asin. Inamin din nila na ang katotohan na maaaring makatulong ang tradisyonal at herbal medicines sa pagpapagaan ng sintomas o kondisyon na dulot ng COVID-19, wala pa ring gamot na direktang lalaban sa virus. Ang steam therapy ay madalas na ginagamit na paraan sa mga tahanan upang malinis ang daanan ng hangin sa ilong. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ REPORT SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. Loop us in on suspicious Facebook pages, groups, accounts, websites, articles, or photos in your network by sending us a message here or contacting us through factcheckphils@gmail.com

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did Vice President Leni Robredo really say this ridiculous quote about teen pregnancy? FALSE! Just because there's a bunch of words next to a person's photo doesn't mean he or she really said it. Even though it is fake, the comments section is ironically filled with people calling the Vice President "bobo" or dumb. It appears that the fake news manufacturers and detractors of the Vice President are running out of content to run. The recent weeks have shown increased activity in recycling content that has already died a natural death before due to the social media cycle or it being fact-checked. We first fact-checked this false claim last January 13, 2020. As we have said before, this is an old meme pattern made to make the Vice President less credible. This is the response of what appears to be a pro-administration disinformation network to the encouragement of VP Robredo to sound the alarm on the crisis of teenage pregnancies as per POPCOM recommendation in October 2019. Popcom said that adolescent pregnancy leads to P33 billion in economic losses with about 1.2 million children having children yearly and 30,000 young mothers having experienced a repeated pregnancy 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Sinabi ba talaga ni Bise Presidente Leni Robredo ang nakakatawang pahayag na ito ukol sa teen pregnancy? MALI! Hindi ibig sabihin na maraming salita sa tabi ng larawan ng isang tao ay sinabi na niya ito. Kahit na ito’y peke, ang comment section ay puno pa rin ng mga tao na tumatawag sa Bise Presidente bilang “bobo”. Mukhang nauubusan na ang mga gumagawa ng pekeng balita at mga kritiko ng maibabato sa Bise Presidente. Sa nakalipas na mga linggo, tumataas ang bilang ng mga inilalabas nilang isyu na matagal nang namatay sa social media cycle o napasinungalingan na. Una nating na-fact check ang isyung ito noong ika-13 ng Enero, 2020. Tulad nang una nating sinabi noon, ito ay karaniwang pattern ng meme kung saan pinalilitaw na walang kredibilidad ang Bise Presidente. Ito ay tugon ng tila isang network ng maling impormasyon na maka-administrasyon sa panawagan ni VP Robredo ukol sa krisis ng teen pregnancy, batay na rin sa rekomendasyon ng POPCOM noong Oktubre 2019. Sinabi ng Popcom na ang adolescent pregnancy ay nauuwi sa pagkawala ng P33 bilyon sa ating ekonomiya dahil sa pagkakaoon ng anak ng 1.2 milyong kabataang babae taun-taon at muling pagbubuntis ng 30,000 batang ina. REPORT THIS AS FALSE NEWS: SOURCES: This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did Senator Risa Hontiveros really file a bill that will guarantee minimum wage and benefits for 'rebels'? False, according to the post made by Hontiveros' official Facebook page. The manipulated fake news photo asserted that the senator filed a bill that would give a minimum wage and government-mandated benefits to rebel groups. The senator refuted the news by saying that this is an old piece of fake news. "No, I did not file this," said Hontiveros on a Facebook post that stamped that manipulated photo with the words "FAKE NEWS." The poster also claimed that the Commission on Audit (COA) ordered Hontiveros to return 1.7 billion during her stint as a board member of Philhealth. This is also another recycled piece of fake news as no more than Philhealth Corporate Communications Manager Rey Baleña said, “Former Board Member and now Senator Risa Hontiveros is not included in the subject Notice of Disallowance (ND).” Hontiveros reminded people who are paying troll farms to just donate their money to personal protective equipment or PPEs. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Naghain ba talaga si Senador Risa Hontiveros ng panukalang maggagarantiya ng minimum wage at benepisyo sa mga 'rebelde’? Mali, ayon mismo sa post ng official Facebook page ni Hontiveros. Nakasaad sa minanipulang larawan ng nasabing balita na naghain ang senadora ng panukala na magbibigay ng minimum wage at iba pang mga benepisyo na itinakda ng pamahalaan sa mga rebeldeng grupo. Itinanggi ng senadora ang balita sa pagsasabing ito’y lumang pekeng balita. “Hindi ako naghain nito,” wika ni Hontiveros sa isang Facebook post kung saan tinatakan ang dinoktor na larawan ng mga salitang "FAKE NEWS." Nakasaad din sa poster also na inutusan ng Commission on Audit (COA) si Hontiveros na ibalik ang 1.7 billion sa kanyang termino bilang board member ng Philhealth. Ito ay binuhay na pekeng balita dahil mismong si Philhealth Corporate Communications Manager Rey Baleña ang nagsabi na “hindi kasama si dating Board Member at ngayo’y Senador na si Risa Hontiveros sa tinutukoy na Notice of Disallowance (ND).” Nagpaalala si Hontiveros sa mga tao na nagbabayad ng troll farms na i-donate na lang ang pera bilang pambili ng personal protective equipment o PPEs. text: Cebu Governor Gwen Garcia is partly false or misleading. This general claim ranges from partly false to false, according to multiple health experts cited in the #CoronaVirusFacts Alliance Database. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did Time Magazine really recognize President Rodrigo Duterte yet again with another "strongman" award? FALSE! A strongman does not have a positive connotation. The video alleged that for the second time, Time Magazine recognized President Duterte as a strongman. The voice over seemed to spun the definition of "strongman" as something that is positive instead of its real definition. The video also also described TIME as a "men's magazine". First, TIME is a news magazine started in 1923 and it never became a men's magazine like Men's Health or Playboy in its 97 years of publication. Also, TIME's depiction of Duterte as a strongman was first published in a 2018 article entitled "The 'Strongmen Era' Is Here. What It Means For You" wherein Foreign Affairs analyst Ian Bremmer cited him as one of the strongmen alongside with Russian President Vladimir Putin, U.S. President Donald Trump, Chinese President Xi Jinping, Turkish Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdoğan and Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán. According to the article, these 'strongmen' are world leaders known for stifling dissent with force and push back against laws and institutions that prevent the abuse of their own power. In his book "Strong Societies and Weak States", international studies expert Joel S. Migdal said that countries in the developing world have weak state institutions not simply because of poor resources but because it is a response to the structural threats to the ruler's power. Migdal concluded that the "stronger" the strongman, the weaker the state institutions that hold that strongman to account. Apparently, President Duterte denied that he is a strongman as described by Bremmer. “I have never sent anybody to jail for criticizing me. I said, for all I care a security guard, or police general, or a teacher, or a gardener can criticize me and bullshit me to no end. I will take that,” said President Duterte during one of his speeches in Davao City on May 4, 2018. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Binigyan ba talaga ng Time Magazine si Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte ng isa pang "strongman" award? MALI! Hindi positibo ang pakahulugan ng salitang strongman. Binanggit sa video na sa ikalawang pagkakataon, kinilala ng Time Magazine si Pangulong Duterte bilang strongman. Sinasabi ng boses sa video na positibo ang kahulugan ng "strongman" sa halip na ang tunay na kahulugan nito. Inilarawan din sa video ang TIME bilang magasin para sa mga lalaki. Una, ang TIME ay isang news magazine na nagsimula noong 1923 at hindi naging magazine para sa mga lalake tulad ng Men's Health o Playboy sa 97 taon nito. Dagdag pa rito, ang paglalarawan ng TIME kay Duterte bilang strongman ay unang lumabas noong 2018 sa artikulong may pamagat na "The 'Strongmen Era' Is Here. What It Means For You" kung saan tinukoy siya ni Foreign Affairs analyst Ian Bremmer bilang sa mga strongman kasama sina Russian President Vladimir Putin, U.S. President Donald Trump, Chinese President Xi Jinping, Turkish Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdoğan at Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán. Ayon sa artikulo, ang mga strongman ay mga pinuno na sinusupil sa mga kumokontra sa kanilang pamumuno gamit ang dahas at pinipigil ang mga batas at institusyon na ang tungkulin ay bantayan ang mga pag-abuso nila sa kapangyarihan. Sa kanyang librong "Strong Societies and Weak States", sinabi ni international studies expert Joel S. Migdal na ang mga papaunlad na bansa ay may mahinang institusyon, hindi dahil sa kakulangan ng mapagkukunan kundi ito’y tugon sa mga banta sa kapangyarihan ng pinuno. Binigyang diin pa ni Migdal na habang lumalakas ang strongman, humihina ang mga institusyon na dapat magpapanagot sa nasabing strongman. Itinanggi naman ni Pangulong Duterte na siya’y isang strongman gaya ng paglalarawan ni Bremmer. “Hindi pa ako nagpakulong ng sinuman na bumatikos sa akin. Kahit sino, maging security guard, police general, guro o hardinero ay maaaring bumatikos sa akin nang walang humpay. Tatanggapin ko iyon,” wika ni Pangulong Duterte sa isa sa kanyang speech sa Davao City noong ika-4 ng Mayo, 2018. SOURCES: Migdal, Joel S. Strong Societies and Weak States: State-Society Relations and State Capabilities in the Third World. Princeton University Press, 1988. This request was submitted by a community fact-checker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 No, young actor McCoy De Leon did not criticize President Rodrigo Duterte nor did he compare ABS-CBN to a comfort room. FALSE, according to an ABS-CBN News report and through De Leon himself. De Leon also released a statement addressing the alleged source who posted the fake quote card. “Kung mababasa mo to wala akong galit, gusto ko sana malaman kung saan kita pwede makausap dahil gusto kitang tulungan. “Pwede mo ko makausap dito sa sarili kong account, i-message mo lang ako (Instagram & Twitter: @hashtag_mccoydl). “Hindi ako ma-social media na tao pero para sayo handa ako makikipag usap kahit ano mang oras. “Tutulungan kita pati ang pamilya mo dahil alam ko sa panahon ngayon maraming taong naghahanap ng pagkakakitaan, atensyon at tulong. Kung nababasa mo man to, bukal sa puso ko ang tumulong mag-aantay ako.” SOURCES: This request was submitted by a community fact-checker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Is wearing a protective face mask dangerous and similar to "inhaling your own farts" as claimed by DJ Loonyo? Partly False, according to multiple fact-checkers and sources from the #CoronaVirusFacts Alliance Database. DJ Loonyo is back on Fact Check Philippines as recent developments from netizens called out another dubious claim from the dancer and social media personality. In this other claim, Loonyo claimed that wearing a mask is dangerous and similar "inhaling your own farts." He also offered advice to put your mask down sometimes in order to breathe "oxygenated" air from plants. Claims like this, without proper context and grounding, are misleading and potentially dangerous to unaware people who would apply them. No, your exhaled breath is not like your flatulence in terms of composition. It is also not harmful to people to wear face masks, as your surgical or cloth mask is designed with breathability in mind. Yes, carbon dioxide or CO2 will accumulate but this is a tolerable amount. We also breathe in small amounts of CO2 in normal respiration. For hypercapnia and hypoxia to happen, you need an extremely high concentration of CO2. Too much CO2 can definitely be life-threatening but for this to happen, the mask needs to be completely glued to your skin at all times which will definitely restrain your breathing. A 2006 study found out that health workers during the 2003 SARS Epidemic were wearing their N95 masks for a prolonged period of time with no breaks. The symptoms that they exhibited were headaches. New protocols were created to prevent this from happening like allowing them to take small breaks. N95 is completely different from your average surgical or cloth masks in terms of breathability. N95 is harder to breathe into, unlike a surgical mask. Non-frontliners are also different from frontliners in terms of the duration of wearing the mask. Wearing a face mask is harmless and in fact, is recommended according to the US Center for Disease Control. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Mapanganib ba ang pagsusuot ng protective face mask dangerous at katulad pa ito ng paglanghap sa inyong utot, gaya ng sinabi ni DJ Loonyo? Ito ay Bahagyang Mali, ayon sa ilang fact-checkers at sources mula sa #CoronaVirusFacts Alliance Database. Nagbabalik si DJ Loonyo sa Fact Check Philippines nang mapansin ng netizens ang isa na namang kaduda-dudang pahayag ng dancer at social media personality. Sa kanyang bagong pahayag, sinabi ni Loonyo na delikado ang pagsusuot ng mask at ito’y katuad ng paglanghap ng inyong sariling utot. Nagbigay rin siya ng payo na hubarin ang mask paminsan-misan para makalanghap ng "oxygenated" na hangin mula sa mga halaman. Ang mga ganitong pahayag, kapag walang tamang konteksto at pinag-uugatan, ay maaaring makapanlinlang at posibleng mapanganib sa mga taong walang sapat na kaalaman na maaaring gumawa nito. Hindi, ang inyong inilalabas na hininga ay hindi katulad ng inyong utot pagdating sa komposisyon nito. Hindi rin mapanganib sa sinuman ang magsuot ng face masks, dahil ang inyong surgical o cloth mask ay dinisenyo para makahinga nang tama ang magsusuot nito. Oo, maiipon ng carbon dioxide o CO2 ngunit kaya ng sinuman ang dami nito. Lumalanghap rin tayo ng kaunting CO2 sa normal nating paghinga. Para mangyari ang hypercapnia at hypoxia, kailangan ng sobrang taas na konsentrasyon ng CO2. Mapanganib ang sobrang daming CO2 ngunit para mangyari ito, dapat ay nakadikit nang buo sa inyong balat ang mask sa lahat ng oras na siyang pipigil sa inyong paghinga. Natuklasan sa isang pag-aaral noong 2006 na ng mga health worker sa panahon ng SARS Epidemic noong 2003 ay nagsuot ng N95 masks sa mahabang panahon na walang pahinga. Ang madalas na sintomas na kanilang pinakita ay pagsakit ng ulo. Bumuo ng bagong protocols upang hindi na maulit ang ganitong pangyayari kung saan pinayagan na silang magpahinga kahit sandali. Ang N-95 ay iba sa karaniwang surgical o cloth masks pagdating sa kakayahang huminga. Mas mahirap huminga sa N95, kumpara sa surgical mask. Iba rin ang non-frontliners sa frontliners pagdatin sa haba ng panahon ng pagsusuot ng mask. Hindi mapanganib ang pagsusuot ng face mask at ito’y inirerekomenda, ayon sa US Center for Disease Control. SOURCES: P.S.Dhami; G.Chopra; H.N. Shrivastava (2015). A Textbook of Biology. Jalandhar, Punjab: Pradeep Publications. pp. V/101. This request was submitted by a community fact-checker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did Jay Sonza really "set the record" straight about ABS-CBN? FALSE, according to the Supreme Court! Fake News King Jay Sonza is back at it again with more disinformation against ABS-CBN. All of this could be simply checked with a simple google search. On September 22, 1972, late dictator Ferdinand Marcos issued his first Letter of Instruction (LOI), ordering the closure of all media organizations, including ABS-CBN. A copy of the LOI is available online via the Official Gazette and can be seen on this link: https://www.officialgazette.gov.ph/1972/09/22/letter-of-instruction-no-1-s-1972/ In to a New York Times article published in 1975, the relationship between the Lopez family and Marcos turned sour when the Lopezes emphasized constitutionalism as Marcos was sliding towards another direction in '69. Two months after Martial Law was declared, Eugenio Lopez Jr. fondly known as Geny and Sergio "Serge" Osmeña III were arrested without charges. Geny, a part of the family that owns the Manila Electric Company (Meralco) that Marcos is eyeing while Serge is the son of Sergio Osmeña who challenged Marcos in the 1969 presidential elections. The 1972 ABS-CBN shutdown forced the Lopez family to "offer" the network to government officials like Juan Ponce Enrile and Kokoy Romualdez but none of the offers materialized. ABS-CBN and Roberto Benedicto, a Marcos crony and owner of Radio Philippines Network (RPN), entered an agreement that RPN would lease the assets of ABS-CBN. ABS-CBN acquiesced to the demands of Benedicto due to the fears of government confiscation and the possibility of Geny being freed. Most of the powerful Lopez assets were given but still, Geny was never freed. Lopez and Osmeña escaped prison and flew to the United States in 1977. This fateful incident was depicted in a 1995 film entitled "Eskapo.: After EDSA, an arbitration agreement was eventually settled by the Supreme Court between ABS-CBN and PTV. All events are listed as facts in these Supreme Court Cases: No more than the Supreme Court records prove that Jay Sonza is indeed lying. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Talaga bang na-“set the record" ni Jay Sonza ang isyu ukol sa ABS-CBN? MALI, ayon sa Korte Suprema! Naglabas na naman ang Fake News King na si Jay Sonza ng panibagong maling impormasyon laban sa ABS-CBN. Lahat nang ito’y maaaring i-check sa pamamagitan lang ng simpleng pagsasaliksik sa google. Noong September 22, 1972, inisyu ni yumaong diktador na si Ferdinand Marcos ang kanyang unang Letter of Instruction (LOI), na nag-uutos na ipasara ang lahat ng media organizations, kabilang ang ABS-CBN. Ang kopya ng LOI ay naka-post online sa Official Gazette at maaaring buksan gamit ang link na ito: Sa isang artikulo ng New York Times na inilabas noong 1975, nakasaad na umasim ang relasyon sa pagitan ng pamilya Lopez at Marcos nang iginiit ng mga Lopez ang constitutionalism dahil unti-unting bumabaling si Marcos sa ibang direksiyon noong '69. Dalawang buwan matapos ideklara ang Martial Law, inaresto sina Eugenio Lopez Jr. na kilala bilang Geny at Sergio "Serge" Osmeña III nang walang anumng kaso. Si Geny ay bahagi ng pamilya na nagmamay-ari ng Manila Electric Company (Meralco) na gustong kunin ni Marcos habang si Serge naman ay anak ni Sergio Osmeña na nakalaban ni Marcos sa halalan sa pagkapangulo noong 1969. Dahil sa pagsasara ng ABS-CBN noong 1972, napilitan ang pamilya Lopez na ialok ang network sa mga opisyal ng gobyerno gaya nina Juan Ponce Enrile at Kokoy Romualdez ngunit pawang hindi natuloy. Pumasok sa kasunduan ang ABS-CBN at Roberto Benedicto, isang Marcos crony at may-ari ng Radio Philippines Network (RPN), kung saan uupahan ng RPN ang mga ari-arian ng ABS-CBN. Pumayag ang ABS-CBN sa hinihingi ni Benedicto sa takot na kumpiskahin ng pamahalaan at sa posibilidad na mapalaya si Geny. Karamihan sa malalaking ari-arian ng mga Lopez ay ibinigay ngunit hindi pa rin napalaya si Geny. Tumakas sina Lopez at Osmeña sa bilangguan at lumipad patungong Estados Unidos noong 1977. Ang nasabin insidente ay itinampok sa pelikula na pinamagatang "Eskapo” noong 1995. Matapos ang EDSA, pumasok ang ABS-CBN at PTV sa isang arbitration agreement na binuo ng Supreme Court. Ang lahat ng pangyayari ay nakalista bilang katotohnan sa mga kasong ito sa Korte Suprema: Mismong mga record na ng Supreme Court ang nagpapatunay na nagsisinungaling si Jay Sonza. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did Vice President Leni Robredo really endorse playing basketball during the time of COVID-19? False, according to a quick cursory search in all of Vice President Leni Robredo's Official Social Media Platforms. The Facebook page of the Vice President contained no statement about it and there is no media organization reported on the matter. The most recent statement of VP Robredo is about the bad timing and wrong prioritization of the Anti-Terrorism Bill in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic. The most recent COVID-19 awareness post by Robredo's official social media platforms was a video from May 30, 2020 regarding social distancing and other safety measures under general community quarantine (GCQ). The caption reads: "Safety tips for offices reopening under GCQ [A] WATCH: Visual cues, physical distancing, frequent handwashing, atbp.—narito ang ilang tips mula kay VP Leni para sa inaasahang pagbabalik-opisina ng marami sa ilalim ng general community quarantine. Ang mga mungkahing ito ay batay sa karanasan ng ating Tanggapan sa pagpapatupad ng alternative working arrangements sa gitna ng COVID-19, gayundin sa mga payo ng mga ekspertong ating kinonsulta upang mapabuti ang ating protocols." This fake quote card exactly fits the pattern of previous fake quote cards that target the Vice President in order to paint her in a degrading manner. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Inendorso ba talaga ni Bise Presidente Leni Robredo ang paglalaro basketball ngayong may COVID-19? Mali, ayon sa mabilis na pagsasaliksik sa lahat ng opisyal na social media platforms ni Bise Presidente Leni Robredo. Sa Facebook page ng Bise Presidente, walang anumang pahayag tungkol dito at walang miyembro ng media na nagreport ukol sa isyu. Ang pinakahuling pahayag ni VP Robredo ay tungkol sa hindi napapanahon at maling prayoritasyon ng Anti-Terrorism Bill sa gitna ng COVID-19 pandemic. Ang pinakahuling post sa opisyal na social media platforms ni Robredo ay isang video noong ika-30 ng Mayo ukol sa social distancing at iba pang pag-iingat sa ilalim ng general community quarantine (GCQ). Nakalagay sa caption ay: "Payo ukol sa pag-iingat sa mga magbubukas na tanggapan sa ilalim ng GCQ [A] PANOORIN: Visual cues, physical distancing, madalas na paghuhugas ng kamay, atbp.—narito ang ilang tips mula kay VP Leni para sa inaasahang pagbabalik-opisina ng marami sa ilalim ng general community quarantine. Ang mga mungkahing ito ay batay sa karanasan ng ating Tanggapan sa pagpapatupad ng alternative working arrangements sa gitna ng COVID-19, gayundin sa mga payo ng mga ekspertong ating kinonsulta upang mapabuti ang ating protocols." Ang pekeng quote card na ito ay akma sa itsura ng mga nakalipas na pekeng quote cards na nakatuon sa Bise Presidente upang ilarawan siya sa pangit na pamamaraan. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did Jackie Chan, Lady Gaga, Taylor Swift, and Justin Bieber really tweet their support for President Rodrigo Duterte? FALSE! The posts by a certain Mike Dumasin in several pro-administration Facebook groups are nothing more than manipulated images of the tweets of these celebrities. Jackie Chan did meet President Rodrigo Duterte back in August 2019 in Beijing during an official trip but this is completely unrelated to the tweet of Jackie Chan on April 3, 2020 when he offered support during this pandemic. Gaga's original tweet on May 23 was about her online store for her Chromatica merchandise. Her photo with Ellen DeGeneres is from an April 28, 2011 performance of her song "Judas" on The Ellen DeGeneres Show Taylor Swift's original tweet last Mar 17, 2020 was about her cat Meredith and not about Bad Blood. Taylor Swift said that the inspiration for Bad Blood was because of a beef with an artist who attempted to sabotage one of her concert tours by hiring people who worked for her. Justin Bieber's original tweet last May 14 was about matching the digital downloads of his song "Stuck With U" with Ariana Grande in charity proceeds. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Nag-tweet ba talaga sina Jackie Chan, Lady Gaga, Taylor Swift, at Justin Bieber ng kanilang suporta para kay Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte? MALI! Ang mga post ng isang Mike Dumasin sa ilang pro-administration Facebook groups ay puro minanipulang larawan ng mga tweet ng mga nasabing celebrity. Nakaharap ni Jackie Chan si Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte noong Agosto 2019 sa Beijing sa isang opisyal na biyahe ngunit wala itong kinalaman sa tweet ni Jackie Chan noong ika-3 ng Abril, 2020 nang magpahayag siya ng suporta sa harap ng nangyayaring pandemic. Ang orihinal naman na tweet ni Gaga noong ika-23 ng Mayo ay tungkol sa online store para sa kanyang mga produkto ukol sa Chromatica. Ang kanyang larawan kasama si Ellen DeGeneres ay kuha noon pang ika-28 ng Abril, 2011 sa kanyang pagtatanghal ng kantang "Judas" sa The Ellen DeGeneres Show Ang orihinal na tweet naman ni Taylor Swift noong ika-17 ng Marso, 2020 ay ukol sa kanyang pusa na si Meredith at hindi tungkol sa Bad Blood. Sinabi ni Taylor Swift na ang kanyang inspirasyon Bad Blood ay mula sa kanyang alitan sa kapwa singer na tinangkang isabotahe ang isa sa kanyang mga concert tours sa pamamagitan ng pagkuha ng mga taong nagtatrabaho sa kaya. Ang orihinal naman na tweet ni Justin Bieber noong ika-14 ng Mayo ay tungkol sa kanyang pagnanais na tapatan ang digital downloads ng kanyang awiting "Stuck With U" kasama si Ariana Grande ng donasyon sa charity.
