text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did the World Health Organization really mix the 'vaccines' with microchips and is COVID-19 just misdiagnosed thrombosis and cardiac arrest? False, according to the #CoronaVirusFacts Alliance Database. There are 227 treatments in consideration while there are 159 vaccines in DEVELOPMENT, according to the latest figures from the Milken Institute. As of now, there is still no mass production of a COVID-19 vaccine so it would be impossible to claim that the World Health Organization (WHO), which Facebook user Joshua Leola purposely renamed as "World Hazard Organization" in order to discredit it, that it already has a direct hand in vaccine mass production and adding a supposed microchip to it when the vaccine hasn't been developed yet. Leola also claimed that the microchip could also turn the vaccine into a virus that is unsupported by any source or any science that exists today. In reality, vaccines, since their inception, have always had a WEAKENED or INACTIVATED version of the virus or molecular parts of it. A vaccine works by training the immune system to recognize and combat pathogens, either viruses or bacteria. To do this, certain molecules from the pathogen must be introduced into the body to trigger an immune response. This life-saving invention has been deemed safe throughout history. We're advising everyone to stop spreading anti-vaxxer statements because it would risk children, aging individuals, and immunosuppressed individuals. The recycled beliefs of microchips in vaccines are decades-old Christian conspiracy theories that are commonly heard in protestant based groups who preach about the rapture and the end of days. This is nothing but a fiction conceived by Christian Conspiracy theorists. Thrombosis is one of the repercussions of COVID-19. According to the Poynter Institute, Peruvian fact-checking network Ojo Público spoke with medical experts from the WHO who confirmed that the body will sometimes react to the coronavirus with an aggressive immune response called a “cytokine storm.” This immune overdrive can lead to inflammation, which is why the experts believe thrombosis emerges in some patients. Pneumonia and Thrombosis are closely associated with COVID-19. Worsening conditions may lead to cardiac arrest. If the Fabunan Antiviral Injection Supporters FB Group really cares about science and saving lives then the moderators of the group should moderate more and delete conspiracy theories that harm the trust in science. Postmortem autopsy of COVID-19 remains is not illegal as proven by this Philippine Study on our first COVID-19 case: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7154063/ The fact still remains that autopsy poses a great risk to health workers as the virus can be transmitted through bodily fluids. The DOH has recommended the immediate cremation within the 12 hours of death though DOH Circular 2020- 0047. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Inihahalo ba talaga ng World Health Organization ang ‘bakuna’ sa microchips at ‘misdiagnosed’ na thrombosis at cardiac arrest lang ba ang COVID-19? Mali, ayon sa #CoronaVirusFacts Alliance Database. Mayroong 227 proseso ng paggamot ang kinokonsidera habang 159 bakuna naman ang nasa bahagi na ng tinatawag na DEVELOPMENT, ayon sa mga bagong numero mula sa Milken Institute. Sa ngayon, wala pang mass production ng isang COVID-19 vaccine kaya imposible na sabihin na ang World Health Organization (WHO), na tinawag ni Facebook user Joshua Leola bilang "World Hazard Organization" upang ito’y siraan, ay may direktang kinalaman sa malawakang paggawa ng bakuna at pagdagdag umano ng microchip dito ngayong wala pang natutuklasang bakuna. Ang pahayag ni Leola na ang microchip ay may kakayahang gawing virus ang bakuna ay hindi sinusuportahan ng anumang source o siyensiya na mayroon sa kasalukuyan. Ang katotohanan, ang mga bakuna, mula nang sila’y matuklasan, ay nagtataglay ng PINAHINA o INACTIVATED na bersiyon ng virus o napakaliit na bahagi nito. Gumagana ang bakuna kapag tinuruan na nito ang immune system na tukuyin at labanan ang pathogens, maging ito man ay virus o bacteria. Paraa mangyari ito, ilang partikular na molecules mula sa pathogen ang dapat ipasok sa katawan para mag-react ang immune system. Ang imbensiyong ito na nakapagsalba na ng maraming buhay ay itinuturing na ligtas sa kabuuan ng ating kasaysayan. Pinapayuhan natin ang lahat na iwasan ang pagkakalat ng mga pahayag na kumokontra sa paggamit ng bakuna, dahil inilalagay nito sa panganib ang mga bata, matatanda at mga indibidwal na “immunosuppressed.” Ang paulit-ulit na paniwala ukol sa microchips sa vaccines ay ilang dekada nang conspiracy theory ng ilang Kristiyanong organisasyon na madalas naririnig sa mga grupong protestante na nagtuturo uokol sa rapture at sa katapusan ng mga araw. Ito ay pawang kasinungalingan lang na inimbento ng Christian Conspiracy theorists. Ang Thrombosis ay isa sa mga resulta ng COVID-19. Ayon sa Poynter Institute, nakipag-usap ang Peruvian fact-checking network na Ojo Público sa mga eksperto sa larangan ng medisina mula sa WHO, na kinumpirma na ang katawan ay nagre-react minsan sa coronavirus sa pamamagitan ng agresibong pagkilos ng immune system na tinatawag na “cytokine storm.” Ang pagkilos na ito ng immune system ay nauuwi sa pamamaga, kaya naniniwala ang mga eksperto na ito ang dahilan kaya nagkakaroon ng thrombosis ang ilang pasyente. Ang Pneumonia at Thrombosis ay inuugnay sa COVID-19. Ang lumalalang kondisyon nito ay maaaring humantong sa cardiac arrest. Kung talagang nakatuon ang Fabunan Antiviral Injection Supporters FB Group sa siyensiya at pagliligtas ng buhay, dapat gawin ng moderators ang kanilang trabaho na mag-moderate at burahin ang mga conspiracy theories na nakakasira ng tiwala sa siyensiya. Ang postmortem autopsy ng COVID-19 ay hindi ilegal gaya nang pinatunayan ng pag-aaral ng Pilipinas sa una nating COVID-19 case: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7154063/ Nananatili ang katotohanan na ang pagsasagawa ng autopsy ay malaking banta sa ating health workers dahil ang virus ay maaaring mailipat sa bodily fluids. Inirekomenda ng DOH ang agarang cremation sa loob ng 12 oras ng kamatayan sa pamamagitan ng DOH Circular 2020- 0047. SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community fact-checker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Does 'Mass Testing' imply that there is a testing of vaccines and drugs in people by 'trial and error' as claimed by DJ Loonyo? FALSE, according to standard medical definitions confirmed through a quick google search. “My question is, bakit pa mag ma-mass testing? If ever sasabihin mong itong vaccine na ito is 100%… na gagana, bakit mo ima-mass testing? Right? So ibig sabihin, ‘yung mass testing kawawa ‘yun! Kung sino ‘yung kasama sa mass testing na ‘yun, good luck kung anong reaction ‘yung gagawin ng katawan mo kung kabilang ka dun sa mass testing!” DJ Loonyo said on a livestream yesterday, June 3, 2020 World Health Organisation (WHO) director-general Tedros Adhanom has stated that countries fighting the coronavirus should “test, test, test”. Hermione Dace, a policy analyst from the Tony Blair Institute for Global Change, argued that "mass testing is essential for both getting people the treatment they need now and for eventually easing lockdown measures and enabling people to get back to work." According to the news website Interasksyon, mass testing is also the term used by the WHO and the Department of Health to refer to the need to detect COVID-19 patients as part of the process to “flatten the curve” or reduce the number of cases to a manageable level. Clinical trials, on the other hand, are research studies performed in people that are aimed at evaluating a medical, surgical, or behavioral intervention. They aim to see if a particular drug, vaccine, method, or equipment is safe and effective. Clinical trials are done under strict ethical guidelines and will have to secure your informed positive consent before you undergo such a program. DJ Loonyo has expressed his apology on Twitter for the “wrong use of terminology" and reassured the public that he is "open-minded" and will continue to do research. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Ang 'Mass Testing' ba ay 'trial and error' na pagsubok sa mga bakuna at gamot sa tao gaya ng sinabi ni DJ Loonyo? MALI, ayon sa mga karaniwang depinisyong medikal na kinumpirma gamit ang mabilis na pagsasaliksik sa google. “Ang tanong ko, bakit pa mag ma-mass testing? Kung sakali sasabihin mong itong vaccine na ito is 100%… na gagana, bakit mo ima-mass testing? Tama? So ibig sabihin, ‘yung mass testing kawawa ‘yun! Kung sino ‘yung kasama sa mass testing na ‘yun, good luck kung anong reaction ‘yung gagawin ng katawan mo kung kabilang ka dun sa mass testing!” sabi ni DJ Loonyo sa isang livestream kahapon, ika-3 ng Hunyo, 2020 Sinabi ni World Health Organisation (WHO) director-general Tedros Adhanom na ang mga bansa na lumalaban sa coronavirus ay dapat mag-“test, test, test”. Iginiit naman ni Hermione Dace, isang policy analyst mula sa Tony Blair Institute for Global Change, na mahalaga ang mass testing para mabigyan ng mga tao ng paggamot na kanilang kailangan ngayon at para sa pagpapaluwag ng lockdown upang makabalik na ang mga tao sa kanilang trabaho. Ayon sa news website na Interasksyon, ang mass testing ay terminong ginamit ng WHO at ng Department of Health para tukuyin ang pangangailangan para matukoy ang mga pasyenteng may COVID-19 bilang bahagi ng proseso para ma-flat ang curve o mabawasan ang bilang ng kaso sa lebel na maaaring kayanin. Ang clinical trials naman, sa isang banda, ay pagsasaliksik na ginagawa ng mga tao na layuning pag-aralan ang mga “medical, surgical, o behavioral” na pagkilos. Nais nilang makita kung ang isang partikular na gamot, bakuna o gamit ay ligtas at mabisa. Ang clinical trials ay ginagawa sa ilalim ng mahigpit na mga panuntunan at dapat munang kunin ang pagsang-ayoon ng sinuman bago siya payagang sumailalim sa nasabing programa. Humingi na ng paumanhin si DJ Loonyo sa Twitter sa mali niyang paggamit ng terminolohiya at tiniyak sa publiko na bukas ang kanyang pag-iisip at patuloy na magsasaliksik. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did Israel, Russia, America, and Japan really pledge their support for India in the instance that China attacks them? FALSE! A cursory search indicated no records for leaders of the said country saying these statements. The closest that India has for a Mutual Defense Treaty is the Indo-Soviet Treaty of Friendship, but it still lacks the security clause needed against external threats unlike the Mutual Defense Treaty and Enhanced Defense Cooperation Agreement (EDCA) of the Philippines and the United States. It is true, however, that India has strong relations with Israel, Russia, the US, and Japan backed with big military deals and agreements but none with mutual defense. Japan also has a pacifist constitution that prohibits the country from having an army. Postcard English is a pro-Modi media organization based on their posts and description on their website, describing themselves as for spirituality, a strategy which Modi utilizes. Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is said to be a rising strongman like President Duterte according to political analysts. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Nangako ba ng suporta ang Israel, Russia, America, at Japan sa India sakaling sakalayin sila ng China? MALI! Batay sa mabilis na pagsasaliksik, walang nakitang anumang record na may ganitong pahayag ang mga lider ng nasabing mga bansa. Ang pinakamalapit na mayroon ang India sa Mutual Defense Treaty ay ang Indo-Soviet Treaty of Friendship, ngunit wala rito ang kailangang security clause laban sa mga panlabas nab banta, hindi gaya ng Mutual Defense Treaty at Enhanced Defense Cooperation Agreement (EDCA) ng Pilipinas at Estados Unidos, na itinuturing ngayon na walang bisa dahil sa pag-atras ni Duterte sa EDCA. Totoo na matibay ang relasyon ng India sa Israel, Russia, US, at Japan at mayroon ding transaksiyong may kinalaman sa militar at mga kasunduan, ngunit wala rito ang may kinalaman sa mutual defense. Ang Japan naman ay mayroong saligang batas na pabor sa kapayapaan at nagbabawal sa bansa na magkaroon ng hukbong sandatahan. Ang Postcard English ay isang pro-Modi media organization batay sa kanilang mga post at deskripsiyon sa kanilang website, na nagsasabing pabor sila sa ispiritwalidad, isang stratehiya na ginamit ni Modi. Sinasabing si Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi ay papausbong na diktador, batay sa ilang political analyst. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did 'Wonder Woman' Gal Gadot really praise Vice President Leni Robredo? FALSE! After a cursory check, we found no records of any statement of the actress in her social media platforms and website. The photo used in the manipulated imag was from Revlon's Live Boldly Campaign back in 2018. We tried searching for the original page or account that posted this but the only page that we found is a page with 218 Likes called 'Fake News in the Philippines'. The page also debunked other fake quote card of celebrities like Oprah, Barack Obama, and Hillary Clinton praising VP Leni. So far, based on the Link Checker tool that we are using, the fake celebrity quote cards which praised VP Leni have a consistent pattern of being shared by DU30 Media Network. (Screenshot at the comments section) 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Pinuri ba talaga ni 'Wonder Woman' Gal Gadot si Bise Presidente Leni Robredo? MALI! Matapos ang masusing pagsasaliksik, wala kaming nakitang record ng anumang pahayag ng aktres sa kanyang social media platforms at twebsite. Ang larawang ginamit ay dinoktor na imahe mula sa Live Boldly Campaign ng Revlon noon pang 2018. Sinubukan din naming hanapin ang orihinal na page o account na nag-post nito ngunit ang tanging page na nakita namin ay page na may 218 Likes at na tinatawag na 'Fake News in the Philippines'. Pinabulaanan din ng nasabing page ang iba pang pekeng quote cards ng mga sikat na personalidad tulad nina Oprah, Barack Obama, at Hillary Clinton na pumupuri kay VP Leni. Sa ngayon, batay sa Link Checker tool na aming ginagamit, ang pekeng celebrity quote cards na pumupuri kay VP Leni ay madalas sini-share ng DU30 Media Network. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did American police officers kneel down and pray for Pres. Rodrigo Duterte's safety? FALSE, according to WSVN journalist Franklin White who first tweeted the photo on May 31, 2020. WSVN, virtual channel 7, is a Fox-affiliated television station in Miami, Florida. The incident involving 46-year-old George Floyd from Minneapolis, Minnesota, was the recent case of police brutality against American-Africans. His death was caused by a police officer restraining him with his knee resting on Floyd's neck. Fact Check Philippines stand with our brothers and sisters in the #BlackLivesMatter movement in advancing racial justice. **Note: This is the final version of the caption that accurately represents the issue and event surrounding the death of George Floyd and the #BlackLivesMatter movement.** 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Lumuhod at nagdasal ba talaga ng mga Amerikanong pulis para sa kaligtasan ni Pangulong Duterte? MALI, ayon sa WSVN journalist na si Franklin White, na siyang unang nag-tweet ng nasabing larawan noong ika-31 ng Mayo, 2020. Ang WSVN, virtual channel 7 ay isang television station sa Miami, Florida na ka-partner ng Fox. Ang insidenteng kinasangkutan ng 46-anyos na si George Floyd mula sa Minneapolis, Minnesota, ay ang pinakabagong kaso ng kalupitan ng pulisya laban sa American-Africans. Ang kanyang pagkamatay ay resulta ng pag-ipit ng isang pulis gamit ang kanyang tuhod sa leeg ni Floyd habang pinipigilan. Ang Fact Check Philippines ay kaisa ng ating mga kapatid sa #BlackLivesMatter movement sa pagsusulong ng katarungang panlipunan. SOURCES: This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: The United States of Chromatica does not appreciate this fake news. Fake News is illegal in Chromatica 😉 😂😂😂 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did 'Mother Monster' Lady Gaga really support President Rodrigo Duterte? No, this is FALSE! Lady Gaga did not say any statement about supporting President Duterte based on a cursory search on search engines and on her social media platforms. CNN also did not have such a story even though it is cited as a source. The photo used in the manipulated image was taken back in 2009 during the National Equality March wherein she gave a fiery speech about equal protection for LGBTs. Gaga is a vocal critic of another strongman, U.S. President Donald Trump. She recently called him 'racist' and a 'fool' due to his policies or lack thereof that are inciting the #BlackLivesMatter protests against police violence and brutality all over America. Hindi nagbitiw ng anumang pahayag si Lady Gaga ukol sa pagsuporta kay Pangulong Duterte batay sa pagsasaliksik sa iba’t ibang search engines at sa kanyang social media platforms. Wala rin sa CNN ang nasabing kuwento kahit binanggit ito bilang source. Ang larawang ginamit ay dinoktor na imahe na kinuha noon pang 2009 sa National Equality March kung saan nagbigay siya ng matapang na speech ukol sa pantay na trato sa LGBTs. Si Gaga ay matinding kritiko ng isa pang strongman na si U.S. President Donald Trump. Kamakailan, tinawag niya itong 'racist' at ‘walang alam’ dahil sa kanyang mga polisiya o kawalan nito na nagpapasiklab sa mga protesta ng #BlackLivesMatter laban sa kalupitn ng mga pulis at karahasan sa buong Amerika. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did Shibuya, Japan really put up a portrait of President Rodrigo Duterte and Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe to pay respect to them? False, based on the real image tweeted by GMA-7 journalist Joseph Morong who covered President Duterte's first state visit to Indonesia back in 2016. "A picture of Pres. Duterte is displayed at d National Monument in Indonesia wc he is set to visit @gmanews," he said in a caption accompanying the image. It is worth noting that neither Japan nor Indonesia has a reverential view of their leaders in a way that sees them like spiritual and moral compasses like China or North Korea. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Naglagay ba talaga ang Shibuya, Japan ng portrait nina Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte at Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe bilang pagbibigay galang sa kanila? Mali, batay sa totoong larawan na galing sa tweet ni GMA-7 journalist Joseph Morong, na nag-cover sa unang state visit ni Pangulong Duterte sa Indonesia noong 2016. "Isang larawan ni Pres. Duterte ang naka-display sa National Monument sa Indonesia kung saan nakatakda siyang bumisita @gmanews," sabi sa caption niya na kasama ng larawan. Mahalaga ring mabangit na ang paggalang ng Japan at Indonesia sa kanilang mga lider ay hindi katulad ng China o North Korea na ginagawang spiritual at moral compass ang mga pinuno. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did 'Mr. Morningstar' really praise Francis Leo Marcos? No, this quote card is FALSE. Lucifer is based on a DC Comics character of the same name which explores the story of a fallen angel and a former leader of Hell who abandoned his ruling of the Underworld to become a nightclub owner in Los Angeles. There is also no record of Tom Ellis saying this statement based on a cursory search. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Pinuri ba talaga ni 'Mr. Morningstar' si Francis Leo Marcos? Hindi, ang quote card na ito ay MALI. Si Lucifer Morningstar ang bida sa sikat na Netflix series na "Lucifer" na ginagampanan ni Tom Ellis, ang tao sa larawan. Ang Lucifer ay batay sa karakter ng DC Comics na kaparehong pangalan na tungkol sa isang anghel na bumagsak sa lupa at dating lider ng Impiyerno na iniwan ang kanyang posisyon sa Underworld para maging may-ari ng nightclub sa Los Angeles. text: 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Hindi ba lumambot ang inyong sotanghon matapos ibabad? Nasunog ba ito nang sindihan? Ibig sabihin ba nito ay plastic ang inyong sotanghon? Preno muna tayo dahil maaaring ito’y MALI. Habang nasa lockdown, maraming video at larawan ang lumabas sa Facebook na nagsasabing plastic ang nabili nilang sotanghon. Ang kanilang akusasyon na plastic ang sotanghon ay nakabatay sa dalawang obserbasyong ito: Hindi lumalambot ang sotanghon matapos ibabad. Nasusunog ang sotanghon tulad ng plastic kapag nilagay sa apoy. Ito ang katotohanan: BAKIT ITO NASUSUNOG? Ang sotanghon o vermicelli noodles ay manipis at malinaw na noodles na gawa sa kombinasyon ng mung-bean starch at potato starch. Ang isang partikular na brand ng Yummy.ph, isang Pinoy culinary magazine, ay naghihiwalay sa Sotanghon sa kahawig nitong Misua at Bihon batay sa komposisyon nito. Ang Misua ay gawa sa harina habang ang Bihon ay gawa sa cornstarch at haring mula sa bigas. Isa sa mga brand na sinasabi ng ilang video na plastic ay ang Good Life Vermicelli ng Fly Ace Corporation. Ang Fly Ace ay ang parehong korporasyon na may-ari ng Jolly (Corn, Canola, at Olive Oil) at Doña Elena. Itinanggi ng brand na nahaharap sa nasabing akusasyon ang mga alegasyon sa isang post sa Facebook kung saan sinabi nito na "lahat ng produkto na mayroong starch tulad ng sotanghon ay nasusunog kapag nailapit sa apoy.” Ang starch ay nasusunog. Sa Chemistry, kung nais nating makita ang likido tuald ng tubig na kumulo, tinitingnan natin ng boiling point nito. Kung nais natin makita kung anong pinakamababang temperature masusunog ang isang bagay, titingnan natin ang Flash Point at Autoignition Point nito. Ang starch ay may mababang Autoignition Point. Kilala ang starch na nasusunog. Batay ito sa artikulo ng The Guardian sa UK kung saan ginawa nila ang nasabing eksperimento: https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-3601476/The-hidden-dangers-kitchen-cupboards-DailyMail-com-sets-fire-common-ingredients-terrifying-results.html Ikinumpara nila ang cornstarch sa kahoy na parehong naglalaman ng carbohydrates kaya ito nasusunog. Ang nangyaring pagsabog sa New Taipei Water Park noong 2015 ay pinaniniwalaang nagmula sa overheating ng isang malaking bulto ng powder na gawa sa starch. Totoo na ang panganib na gaya ito ay mangyayari lang sa malaking bulto at kapag kumalat sa hangin at hindi maaaring mangyari sa noodle. Subalit hindi maaalis ang katotohanan na ang Sotanghon, na gawa sa starch, ay nagliliyab. Magkakaroon din ng tunog na parang pumuputok o nagka-crack dahil ang tubig na kumukulo sa loob ng noodles ay nais lumabas matapos maging usok. Ang nasabing tunog ay usok na lumalabas sa pamamagitan ng pag-crack sa noodles tulad ng nangyayaring pag-crack sa kahoy at dahon dahil sa basa na nais lumabas. Dagdag pa rito, sinabi ni Fan Zhihong, isang professor sa College of Food Science and Nutritional Engineering ng China Agricultural University, na hindi dapat ikatakot ang pagkain na nasusunog. "Sinusukat natin ang calories sa ilang pagkain sa pamamagitan ng pagsunog dito. Mag-alala lang tayo kung ligtas ang pagkain kung hindi sila nasusunog,” wika niya. Ang calorie ay unit na nagsusukat sa enerhiya. Sa paraan na tinatawag na calorimetry, sadya nilang sinusunog ang pagain upang malaman kung gaano karaming init ang nilalabas nito, na siyang nagsasabi sa mga siyentepiko kung gaano karaming enerhiya ang laman nito. Ang calorimetry, na nagsusukat ng init na inilalabas o nahihigop kapag may reaksiyon, ay isang paksa na pinag-uusapan ng mga estudyante sa kolehiyo sa basic Chemistry. Ang aral dito ay kapag nasusunog ang isang bagay dahil sa spark, hindi ibig sabihin na ito’y plastic o nakalalason. Minsan, ito’y dahil lang sa batas ng ating kalikasan. BAKIT HINDI ITO LUMAMBOT MATAPOS IBABAD? Hindi lahat ng Sotanghon ay ginawa sa pamamagitan ng isang sistema, ayon sa tinatawag na cooking circles. Ganito rin ang sitwasyon sa pasta. Ang ibang sotanghon ay lumalambot habang ang iba’y hindi ngunit hindi ito nangangahulugan na gawa ito sa plastic. Ang ibang sotanghon ay humihigop ng tubig kapag nilagay sa sabaw habang ang iba naman ay hindi madaling humigop ng tubig. Sa mga recipe sa pagluluto, nakalagay na kapag ibinabad ang sotanghon ay hindi na nito hihigupin ang sabaw kaya mapipilitan kang magdagdag ng tubig na hahantong sa paglabnaw ng sabaw o sauce. Makatutulong ang init para higupin ng starch ang tubig at ma-rehydrate ang pasta nang mabilis. Maaari mong ibabad ang sotanghon sa malamig na tubig ngunit mas matagal bago niya mahigop ang tubig. Nakipag-ugnayan tayo sa Good Life Vermicelli para malman kung bakit hindi lumalambot ang kanilang sotanghon kapag binabad. Ito ang kanilang opisyal na pahayag: "Ang Good Life Premium Vermicelli ay gawa sa premium potato starch, at ang kanilang vermicelli ay gawa sa pea at potato starch kaya napapanatili ito ang tinatawag na firmness at texture kapag niluto. Idinagdag nila na ang firmness ay senyales ng de-kalidad na vermicelli." Ang nasabing tatak ay rehistradong produkto sa FDA: https://ww2.fda.gov.ph/index.php/consumers-corner/registered-food-products/295292-superior-quality-vermicelli Hindi tayo dapat matakot sa mga bagay na hindi natin maunawaan. Minsan, mayroon tayong pagkakataon na unawain ito. 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Your sotanghon didn't soften after being soaked? Does it burn when set ablaze? Does this mean your sotanghon is plastic? Hold your horses because that's probably FALSE. Over the span of the lockdown, several videos and photos have been surfacing on Facebook claiming that the sotanghon they bought is plastic. Their claim of the Sotanghon being plastic are either based on these two observations: The sotanghon does not soften after being soaked. The sotanghon burns "like plastic" when put into a fire. Here are the facts: WHY DOES IT BURN? Sotanghon or vermicelli noodles are thin, transparent noodles made out of a combination of mung-bean starch and potato starch. The specific brand of Yummy.ph, a Filipino culinary magazine, separates Sotanghon from identical Misua and Bihon based on its composition. Misua is made of wheat flour while Bihon is made of cornstarch and rice flour. One of the brands most claimed by several videos as being plastic is Good Life Vermicelli by Fly Ace Corporation. Fly Ace is the same corporation that owns Jolly (Corn, Canola, and Olive Oil) and Doña Elena. The brand facing the accusations denied these allegations in a Facebook post by saying, "all kinds of starch-based products like sotanghon burn when exposed to flame." Starch is flammable. In Chemistry, if we want to see when liquids like water will boil, we refer to its Boiling Point. If we then want to see at which lowest temperature materials will burn or ignite, we refer to its Flash Point and Autoignition Point. Starch has a low Autoignition Point. Starch is commonly known to be flammable. Based on this article by UK's The Guardian where they conducted this experiment: https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-3601476/The-hidden-dangers-kitchen-cupboards-DailyMail-com-sets-fire-common-ingredients-terrifying-results.html They compared cornstarch to wood as both having carbohydrates as to why it burns. The 2015 New Taipei Water Park explosion was believed to be caused by the overheating of a huge amount of starch-based powder. Of course, dangers like this only happens when in large amounts and dispersed in the air which cannot happen in a noodle but still does not remove the fact that Sotanghon, which is made of starch, is flammable. It will eventually produce "popping" or "cracking" sounds because the water that boils inside of the noodles would want to get out after being turned into steam. That popping or frying sound is steam escaping through cracking the noodles similar to wood and leaf cracking because of moisture that wants to get out. Moreover, Fan Zhihong, a professor at the College of Food Science and Nutritional Engineering at China Agricultural University, said that food that is burning is not a cause of concern. "We used to measure the calories in some food by burning them. We should be worried about food safety when some foods cannot be burned," he said. A calorie is a unit that measures energy. In a method called calorimetry, they purposely burn the food to discover how much heat it releases, which tells scientists how much energy contains. Calorimetry, measure heat released or absorbed during a reaction, is also a topic that college students study during basic Chemistry. The lesson here is just because something burns out due to a spark doesn't mean it's plastic or toxic. Sometimes, it's just the way it is because of the laws of nature. WHY DOESN'T IT SOFTEN WHEN SOAKED? Not all Sotanghon is created the same according to cooking circles. The same could be said with pasta. Some sotanghon soften and some do not but that doesn't mean it's plastic. Some sotanghon absorb water when put into the soup and some do not absorb water easily. In cooking recipes, soaking guarantees that a sotanghon will not absorb the soup that will leave you adding more water and therefore diluting the soup or sauce. The heat helps the starch re-absorb water and rehydrate the pasta faster. You could soak it in cold water, but it would take a lot longer to absorb the water. We reached out to Good Life Vermicelli as to why their Sotanghon does not soften after being soaked. This is their official statement: "Good Life Premium Vermicelli is made with premium potato starch, their vermicelli is made with pea and potato starch which make them hold their firmness and good texture when cooked. They added that the firmness is a sign of good quality vermicelli." The brand is an FDA Registered Product: https://ww2.fda.gov.ph/index.php/consumers-corner/registered-food-products/295292-superior-quality-vermicelli We don't have to be afraid of what we don't understand. Sometimes, we have the choice to understand it. FAKE POSTS SOURCES: This request was submitted by a community fact-checker. Loop us in on suspicious Facebook pages, groups, accounts, websites, articles, or photos in your network by sending us a message here or contacting us through factcheckphils@gmail.com

text: Did Ormoc City Mayor Richard Gomez really say he would not accept returnees as claimed by President Rodrigo Duterte? FALSE! President Rodrigo Duterte claimed in his address last May 28, 2020, that Ormoc City Mayor does not want to accept returnees. This claim was a reaction to the Ormoc City Mayor's Facebook post where he made his first statement on the lack of coordination from the agencies in charge of the Balik Probinsya program on Monday, May 25. "DILG, NHA, OWWA, what happened to all the protocols that you guys are trying to formulate for returning residents?!!!" the Ormoc City mayor said in his Facebook post. "Imagine sending people without names or incomplete documents or no documents at all and telling us to accept them? What confirmations do we have that they are from here? It's possible that they left Manila without testing," Gomez said. Upon reading the Facebook post, it could be observed that Mayor Goma's post was only about his frustration and reaction to the lack of coordination. The post only had a single edit history and even in the previous, he did not say he would deny returnees. This Facebook update earned the criticisms of Chief Presidential Legal Counsel Salvador Panelo and DILG Sec Ano. In a follow-up post, Gomez clarified further that there was no coordination from the national government even if they had an inter-agency discussion along with LGUs about the process and protocols of returnees only to be left ignored upon implementation. "Sabi ni Sec. Panelo na natataranta daw ako. Hindi po ako natataranta tulad Po ng sinasabi ninyo. Sumusunod lang po kami sa naunang utos ng DILG mismo sa briefing na ginawa nila sa LGU last Thursday, May 21, na 3 days prior to arrival of repatriates ay dapat may coordination from their LGU of origin and notice from the national agencies para ang ito ay mapaghandaan ng maayos," Gomez said. Gomez bared that the day after, he received a call from Sec. Año where Año admitted there was indeed miscommunication. "Wag niyo po masamain pag humihingi kami ng coordination sa inyo. Hindi po kami kalaban," he said. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. Loop us in on suspicious Facebook pages, groups, accounts, websites, articles, or photos in your network by sending us a message here or contacting us through factcheckphils@gmail.com

text: Can Aspirin and Paracetamol cure COVID-19? FALSE! As of now, there is no available cure or vaccine for COVID-19. The World Health Organization STRONGLY advises against self-medication when experiencing COVID-19 symptoms as it may endanger your life. The Department of Health (DOH) yesterday explained the protocols on treating COVID-19 patients at the Beat COVID-19 Virtual Presser last April 14, 2020. Dr. Marissa Alejandrino explained that the current treatment protocol for COVID-19 patients is only SUPPORTIVE due to the absence of FDA-approved medicines that are effective against the virus. “Binabantayan po natin ang pasyente, binibigyan ng paracetamol, hydration, mino-monitor sa ward, tapos kung mas nahihirapang huminga, ililipat natin sa ICU; pwede po syang mailagay sa ventilator para masuportahan yung function ng baga, so, yun ang standard of care,” she explained. Dr. Marissa Alejandria is the President of the Philippine Society of Microbiology & Infectious Diseases and Professor at the University of the Philippines General Hospital, Department of Clinical Epidemiology, National Institutes of Health. Symptomatic treatment, supportive care, or supportive therapy is any medical therapy of a disease that only affects its symptoms, not the underlying cause. Meaning they only give Paracetamol in order to address a symptom like fever but not the virus that is causing the disease and its symptoms while at the same time putting the patient under constant monitoring. If you think you are experiencing COVID-19 symptoms, please refer to this link: or call the official DOH COVID-19 Hotline: 24/7 DOH COVID-19 Hotline - 02-894-COVID (02-894-26843) or 1555 para sa lahat ng network subscribers SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community fact-checker. Loop us in on suspicious Facebook pages, groups, accounts, websites, articles, or photos in your network by sending us a message here or contacting us through factcheckphils@gmail.com

text: ✈️✈️✈️ FLIP CHECK PHILIPPINES! Today we're introducing a new way of tracking the statements of personalities. We will be using FLIP CHECK to rate the statements of politicians from No Flip, Half Flip, to Flip Flop. A rating system from Poynter Institute's Politifact. This is especially helpful nowadays when public officials are accused of flipping from their original statements, stances, or beliefs. In our first report for Flip Check, we looked into DOH Secretary Francisco Duque's pronouncement of the second wave that launched a thousand tweets. This statement was then scrutinized by Malacanang, IATF, and medical experts leading to Duque to retract and revise his statement. Duque stressed that his original statement was a "casual expression of an epidemiologic fact.” In the end, President Rodrigo Duterte told Duque not to be "touchy" about issues or criticisms during his public address last May 26, 2020. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES:

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Did Vice President Leni Robredo really support the shutdown of ABS-CBN? FALSE, according to several articles that quoted the Vice President on the day that ABS-CBN was forced to go off the air. Rappler quoted VP Robredo, saying that there should be no space for suppression, self-interest in the middle of a pandemic. Meanwhile, Inquirer headlined their article regarding VP Leni's statement questioning the shutdown of ABS-CBN which is helping out more during the pandemic versus POGOs that were allowed to resume operations. Finally, the Philippine Star reported her saying that closure of the network will cost lives as it was the primary source of information of Filipinos. The manipulated image showing the Vice President holding a piece of paper that says "SHUTDOWN ABS-CBN FOREVER" was originally taken from the relief operations in Batangas. It was where VP Leni handed out bowls of Lugaw while at the same time got back at trolls who taunted her Leni Lugaw by holding a piece of paper with that insult written. The manipulated image also shows VP Leni sexualized while obscene versions of the logos of Rappler, ABS-CBN, and Angat Buhay are also superimposed on the image. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Sinuportahan ba talaga ni Bise Presidente Leni Robredo ang pagsasara sa ABS-CBN? MALI, ayon sa ilang mga artikulo na naglalaman ng mga sinabi ng Bise Presidente noong araw na inalis sa ere ang ABS-CBN. Sa artikulo ng Rappler, sinabi ni VP Robredo na dapat ay walang lugar sa panggigipit at pansariling interes sa harap ng nangyayaring pandemya. Samantala, nilabas naman ng Inquirer ang artikulo ukol sa pahayag ni VP Leni na kumukuwestiyon sa pagsara sa ABS-CBN na mas malaki ang naitutulong sa gitna ng pandemya kumpara sa mga POGO na pinayagang magpatuloy ng operasyon. Panghuli, iniulat naman ng Philippine Star ang kanyang sinabi na maaaring maraming buhay ang mabuwis sa pagsasara ng network dahil ito ang pangunahing pinagkukunan ng impormasyon ng mga Pilipino. Ang orihinal ng minanipulang larawan ng Bise Presidente na may hawak na papel na nagsasabi ng "SHUTDOWN ABS-CBN FOREVER" ay kuha sa relief operations sa Batangas. Dito nagpamahagi si VP Leni ng mga mangkok ng Lugaw kasabay ng pagbuwelta sa mga troll na tumawag sa kanya bilang Leni Lugaw sa pamamagitan ng paghawak ng piraso ng papel kung saan nakasulat ang bansag sa kanya. Binastos din si VP Leni sa minanipulang larawan dahil ipinatong sa imahe ang malaswang bersiyon ng mga logo ng Rappler, ABS-CBN, at Angat Buhay. text: Did ABS-CBN violate laws as claimed by SAGIP Partylist Rep. Rodante Marcoleta? FALSE, according to the different government agencies that are implementing the laws that Rep. Marcoleta cited. This was all tackled during the Senate hearing on ABS-CBN's franchise last February 24, 2020. After waiving their right to privacy, ABS-CBN disclosed that they have paid ₱14.398 billion from 2016 to 2019. The amount excludes income taxes which are due April 15 according to Simplicio Cabantac, Jr., head of a unit of the BIR Large Taxpayers Service, told the Senate Committee on Public Services. SEC Commissioner Ephyro Amatong said that they are not aware of any violation committed by the company. They also made it clear that since ABS-CBN is a corporation, it is subjected to laws that require it to submit documentary requirements for reporting. The Philippine Depositary Receipts are investment instruments that allows corporations or individuals -\-\ Filipino or not -\-\ to receive dividends earned by the company. Possession of PDRs does not automatically mean that you own a percentage of a corporation or a share of it especially that foreigners are not allowed to convert their PDRs into shares. Ex-PSE President, Atty. Francis Lim likens it to a betting pool. “[You] buy a ticket to bet on a horse. You don’t own the horse, if that horse wins, you have a share in the winning," said Lim in an interview with ANC's Early Edition. In the same Senate hearing, ABS-CBN clarified that the 11,000+ number of employees is the total number of employees that comprises the whole ABS-CBN Group and not just the 5000+ that the flagship television station Channel 2 employs. With regards to ENDO, ABS-CBN answered Sen. Villanueva's query by saying that ABS-CBN does not use ENDO but uses "project-based" employees for the production of their shows. They added that these employees enjoy a 25-item benefit package aside from the government statutory package (SSS, PhilHealth, PAG-IBIG, and 13th month pay). A sample of the itemized list of benefits can be found in @scorsaguin's Twitter account, who is a mid-tier Twitter influencer known to work in ABS-CBN: https://twitter.com/i/status/1265184869501427714 It is important to take note that President Rodrigo Duterte rejected the Security of Tenure Bill that would have ended all forms of contractualization, a provision that his ENDO EO did not contain. He echoed the line of business groups saying "businesses should be allowed to determine whether they should outsource certain activities or not.” FILIPINO Lumabag ba ang ABS-CBN sa batas gaya ng akusasyon ni SAGIP Partylist Rep. Rodante Marcoleta? MALI, ayon sa iba’t ibang ahensiya ng pamahaaan na nagpapatupad ng mga batas na nabanggit ni Rep. Marcoleta. Lahat nang ito ay natalakay sa pagdinig ng Senado ukol sa prangkisa ng ABS-CBN noong ika-24 ng Pebrero 2020. Matapos i-waive ang kanilang right to privacy, ipinabatid ng ABS-CBN na nagbayad sila ng buwis na ₱14.398 bilyon mula 2016 hanggang 2019. Hindi pa rito kasama ang income tax na nakatakdang bayaran sa ika-15 ng Abril, ayon kay Simplicio Cabantac, Jr., pinuno ng BIR Large Taxpayers Service unit, sa pagdinig ng Senate Committee on Public Services. Ayon naman kay SEC Commissioner Ephyro Amatong, wala silang nalalaman na anumang paglabag sa batas na ginawa ng kompanya. Nilinaw rin nila na dahil isang korporasyon ang ABS-CBN, saklaw pa rin ito ng mga batas na nag-oobliga rito na magsumite ng mga kailangang dokumento para sa kanilang ulat. Ang Philippine Depositary Receipts ay tinatawag na investment instruments na nagbibigay daan sa mga korporasyon at indibidwal – Pilipino man o hindi – na tumanggap ng dibidendo mula sa kinita ng kompanya. Ang pagkakaroon ng PDRs ng sinuman ay hindi awtomatikong nangangahulugan na pag-aari na nila ang bahagi ng korporasyon o mga share nito lalo pa’t hindi maaaring ipalit ng mga dayuhan ang kanilang PDRs sa shares ng kompanya. Inihalintulad ito ni dating PSE President, Atty. Francis Lim sa pinagsama-samang taya sa isang sugal. “Bumili ka ng tiket para pumusta sa isang kabayo. Hindi mo pag-aari ang kabayo, ngunit kapag nanalo ang kabayo, may bahagi ka sa napanalunan," wika ni Lim sa panayam ng programang Early Edition ng ANC. Sa nasabing pagdinig ng Senado, nilinaw ng ABS-CBN na ang kanilang mahigit 11,000 empleyado ay kabuuang bilang ng mga tauhan sa kabuuan ng ABS-CBN Group at hidi lang ang mahigit limang libo na nagtatrabaho sa flagship television station na Channel 2. Pagdating naman sa ENDO, sinagot ng ABS-CBN ang tanong ni Sen. Villanueva sa pagsasabing hindi gumagamit ang ABS-CBN ng ENDO kundi "project-based" employees para sa paggawa ng kanilang show. Ang mga nasabing empleyado ay mayroong benepisyo na binubuo ng 25 bagay, maliban pa sa mga benepisyong itinakda ng pamahalaan gaya ng SSS, PhilHealth, PAG-IBIG, at 13th month pay). Ang sample ng mga listahan ng benepisyo ay makikita sa Twitter account ni @scorsaguin, isang Twitter influencer na kilalang nagtatrabaho sa ABS-CBN: https://twitter.com/i/status/1265184869501427714 Mahalagang mabigyang diin na ibinasura ni Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte ang Security of Tenure Bill na dapat ay tatapos sana sa anumang uri ng kontraktuwalisasyon, isang probisyon na wala sa kanyang ENDO EO. Inulit lang niya ang pahayag ng mga grupo ng negosyante na "dapat hayaan ang mga negosyo na alamin kung dapat bang i-outsource ang ilang uri ng aktibidad o hindi.” -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Was Masagana 99 an effective use of commercial and rural banks as claimed by Sen. Imee Marcos? FALSE, according to Department of Finance Secretary Carlos "Sonny" Dominguez III who served as the Secretary of Agriculture, Director of Land Bank of the Philippines and Minister of Natural Resources during the administration of Pres. Corazon Aquino. He responded to Sen. Imee Marcos by saying that there were about 800 rural banks bankrupted by the Masagana 99 and it was them who rescued those banks from bankruptcy. Dominguez, a trusted friend and former classmate of President Rodrigo Duterte, is a businessman and finance expert. He's a graduate of BS Economics and Master of Business Administration from Ateneo De Manila University. He also completed the Executive Program from Stanford University's Graduate School of Business. His claim is supported by research done by the World Bank in a 1983 report entitled "Philippines - Agricultural Credit Sector Review" which highlighted the rural bank insolvency or bankruptcy as a result of non-payment by farmer-borrowers of their loans due to the lack of regulation by the Marcos government. A 1987 study from International Rice Research Institute (IRRI) also concluded that availing loans from Masagana 99 made no difference in net returns for farmers For former NEDA director-general Emmanuel Esguerra, Masagana 99 was more political than economical as it didn't really address the root cause of inequality which is asset ownership. Aside from economic damage and political patronage, Masagana 99 also left a legacy of environmental damage due to the program's heavy reliance on pesticides which led to pest outbreaks and devastation of local plants and animals. The Marcos family has a record of releasing statements or campaigns that aim to revise history. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Mabisa nga bang paggamit ng mga bangko ang Masagana 99 ayon kay Sen. Imee Marcos? HINDI TOTOO! Hindi totoo, ayon kay Department of Finance Secretary Carlos "Sonny" Dominguez III na naging Secretary of Agriculture, Director of Land Bank of the Philippines, at Minister of Natural Resources noong sumunod na administrasyon ni dating Pangulong Corazon Aquino. Sinagot niya si Sen. Imee Marcos sa pagsabing mga 800 rural banks ang nalugi dahil sa kalat ng Masagana 99 base sa kanyang karanasan bilang Secretary of Agriculture na sumubok tulungan mula sa pagkalugi ang bangkong iyon. Si Dominguez, isang pinagkakatiwalaang kaibigan at dating kaklase ni Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte ay isang businessman at finance expert. Siya ay nagtapos ng BS Economics at Master in Business Administration sa Ateneo de Manila. Graduate rin siya ng Executive Program mula sa Graduate School of Business ng Stanford University. Ang kanyang sagot kay Sen. Imee Marcos ay suportado ng pag-aaral na ginawa ng World Bank noong 1983 na may pamagat na "Philippines - Agricultural Credit Sector Review." Sinabi sa pag-aaral ang naturang insolvency o pagkalugi ng mga rural banks dahil umano sa hindi pagkabayad ng mga magsasakang humiram ng pera dahil na rin sa kawalan ng regulasyon ng administrayon ng dating diktador. Wala ring naging epekto sa kabuuang kita ng mga magsasaka dahil sa paghiram nila sa Masagana 99 ayon sa isang pag-aaral ng IRRI noong 1987. Para naman kay dating NEDA Director- General Emmanuel Esguerra, ang Masagana 99 ay mas pulitikal kesa ekonomikal. Bukod sa pinsala na ginawa sa ekonomiya, nag-iwan rin ang Masagana 99 ng pinsala sa kalikasan dahil umaaasa ito sa matinding paggamit ng mga pesticides na nagresulta sa pagdami ng mga peste at pagkasira ng lokal na halaman at mga hayop. Ang pamilya Marcos ay may record ng paglalabas ng mga pahayag o kampanya na nais ibahin ang kasaysayan. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 PARTLY FALSE! While it is true that this initiative from Vice President Leni Robredo and Community Mart will help Quezon City Market vendors and displaced tricycle drivers, the photo used in the article's Facebook post is not the aid that the Office of The Vice President is giving. The Interaksyon article photo was taken during the Office of The Vice President's Taal Relief Operations. The photo was taken last January 14, 2020. Community Mart is an Android / iOS app that connects consumers to informal vendors in QC markets and utilizes the services of tricycle driver who were displaced during the lockdown. The photo has now been updated by Interaksyon presumably to avoid confusion and manipulation. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 PARTLY FALSE Bagamat totoo na ang inisyatibong ito mula kay Bise Presidente Leni Robredo at Community Mart ay makakatulong sa mga manininda sa palengke sa Quezon City at mga tricycle driver na nagtigil pasada, ang larawan na ginamit sa artikulo ay hindi ang sinasabing tulong na ibinibigay ng Office of the Vice President. Ang larawan ay kinuha mula sa pamamahagi ng ayuda ni Vice President Leni Robredo noong January 14, 2020 dahil sa pagsabog ng Bulkang Taal. Ang Community Mart ay isang app para sa Android at iOS na nag-uugnay sa mga mamimili at nagtitinda sa palengke sa Quezon City at gumagamit rin ng serbisyo ng mga pumapasada ng tricycle para ihatid ang ipabiling produkto. Binago na ng Interaksyon ang larawan para hindi makalito o magamit sa manipulasyon. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: Photo -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 FALSE AND MISLEADING! No, there have been no decisions made yet about the extension of the Enhanced Community Quarantine until May 31, 2020. This is just a press release from the senate website where in Sen. Franklin Drilon warned against the premature lifting of the lockdown last April 3, 2020. "We are only beginning to see the data. I see some data that shows it is effective, but it is too early to tell. An extra two weeks would help," he said in the press release. Even with the support of the two-week extension back then, he did not say that the lockdown should last until May 31, 2020. Drilon said that government must ensure food supply and movement of essential goods and services. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 FALSE AND MISLEADING! Hindi totoong may desisyon na tungkol sa pag-extend ng Enhanced Community Quarantine hanggang May 31, 2020. Ito ay isa lamang press release mula sa Senate website kung saan nagbabala si Sen. Franklin Drilon tungkol sa maagang pag-alis ng lockdown noong April 3, 2020 "We are only beginning to see the data. I see some data that shows it is effective, but it is too early to tell. An extra two weeks would help," sinabi niya sa press release. Bagamat suportado niya ang pag-extend ng lockdown noon, wala pa ring nabanggit ang press release na sinuportahan ni Drilon ang lockdown hanggang May 31, 2020. Ayon kay Drilon, kailangang masigurado ng gobyerno ang tamang supply ng pagkain at ang paggalaw ng essential goods. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 FALSE! No, Oyo Boy Sotto did not say this statement about President Rodrigo Duterte's critics. Sotto already posted on Instagram saying that the quote did not come from him last November 2019. "Gusto ko lang po linawin na hindi sa akin galing ang mga salitang nasa picture," he said in a post. The fake quote card has existed for a while even before he posted on Instagram. Now. it has again resurfaced with another layout variation of a green quote card. Sotto ended his post with a warning against fake news by using the hashtag #MaramingNamamataySaAkala. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 FALSE! Hindi totoong sinabi ni Oyo Sotto ang pahayag na ito tungkol sa mga kritiko ni Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte. Nagpost na si Sotto sa Instagram noong November 2019 at sinabi niyang hindi sa kanya nanggaling ang pahayag na ito. "Gusto ko lang po linawin na hindi sa akin galing ang mga salitang nasa picture," sinabi niya sa post. Ang pekeng quote card na ito ay matagal nang kumakalat sa internet bago pa man siya magpost sa Instagram. Nabuhay na naman ito ngayon na may panibagong layout na kulay berde ang background ng imahe ni Oyo Boy kasama ang pekeng pahayag. Tinapos ni Sotto ang kanyang post na may paaalalang huwag maniwala sa fake news sa paggamit ng hastag #MaramingNamamataySaAkala. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: Fact Check Philippines will be using the following recommended ratings from Facebook and the International Fact Checkers Network. In answering the question, "How accurate is this content?", we will be using the following to answer it: False: The primary claim(s) of the content are factually inaccurate. This generally corresponds to “false” or “mostly false” ratings on fact-checkers' sites. Partly False: The claim(s) of the content are a mix of accurate and inaccurate, or the primary claim is misleading or incomplete. True: The primary claim(s) of the content are factually accurate. This generally corresponds to “true” or “mostly true” ratings on fact-checkers' sites. False Headline: The primary claim(s) of the article body content are true, but the primary claim within the headline is factually inaccurate. Satire: The content is posted by a Page or domain that is a known satire publication, or a reasonable person would understand the content to be irony or humor with a social message. It still may benefit from additional context. Prank generator: Websites that allow users to create their own “prank” news stories to share on social media sites.

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 PARTLY FALSE! (MISLEADING) While it is true that Bayan Muna Rep. Carlos Zarate said this statement, it had no effect to the passage and implementation of the Philippine ID System (PhilSys) as Rep. Zarate said this last March 18, 2018 while the law was signed on August of the same year. This post by Mindavote is MISLEADING to attribute the delay of the PhilSys on Rep. Zarate. It is also FALSE to imply that the Philippine ID Act was not passed as we have reported previously. In 2016, Zarate also filed a resolution to investigate UniSys, the lone bidder for the project, but the resolution never left the committee level. Senators Sotto and Lacson filed a resolution to investigate the delay on the implementation of PhilSys. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 PARTLY FALSE (MISLEADING) Bagamat totoo na sinabi ito ni Bayan Muna Rep. Carlos Zarate, wala itong kinalaman o naging epekto sa pagpasa o implementasyon ng Philippine ID System (PhilSys) dahil sinabi ito ni Rep Zarate noong March 18, 2018 habang napasa ang batas noong August ng parehong taon. Ang post na ito ng Mindavote ay MISLEADING dahil sa pagpapahiwatig nito na ang delay ng implemtasyon ng PhilSys ay dahil kay Rep. Zarate. FALSE rin na sabihin na hindi pa napapasa ang Philippine ID Act gaya ng naiulat namin nitong kamakailan lang. In 2016, nagahain ng resolusyon si Zarate para imbestigahan ang Unisys, ang nag-iisang bidder para sa proyekto, ngunit hindi umusad ang resolusuon sa labas ng komite. Pagkatapos ng pahayag ni Pangulong Duterte na wala pang Philippine ID na batas, naghain ng resolusyon sina Sen. Lacson at Sotto para imbestigahan ang mabagal na paggalaw ng proyekto. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. Loop us in on suspicious Facebook pages, groups, accounts, websites, articles, or photos in your network by sending us a message here or contacting us through factcheckphils@gmail.com REPORT SOURCES:

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 No, this is not a video of COVID-19 dead bodies dumped in the sea by "some countries." This is a video of an immigrant disaster wherein dead bodies of African migrants were found on a beach in Libya back in August 2014 The original video was entitled, "Mediterranean Sea Becomes A Cemetery For African Immigrants." There has been no advisory that warned against eating seafood due to COVID-19. The World Health Organization (WHO) has also released guidelines for the proper handling of a dead body in the context of COVID-19. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Hindi totoong video ito ng mga banagkay ng mga namatay sa COVID-19 na itinapon sa dagat ng mga ilang bansa. Ito ay video na patungkol sa immigrant disaster kung saan natagpuan ang mga African migrants sa pampang sa Libya noong August 2014. Ang orihinal na title ng video ay, "Mediterranean Sea Becomes A Cemetery For African Immigrants." Wala ring advisory na ipinagbabawal ang pagkain ng lamang-dagat dahil sa COVID-19. Naglabas rin ang World Health Organization ng guidelines para sa tamang paghawak ng mga bangkay na namatay dahil sa COVID-\-\19. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: FAKE NEWS SOURCE: Mediterranean Sea Becomes A Cemetery For African Immigrants Euro news report on the incident: WHO guidelines on handling of dead bodies in the context of COVID-19 -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. Loop us in on suspicious Facebook pages, groups, accounts, websites, articles, or photos in your network by sending us a message here or contacting us through factcheckphils@gmail.com
tags: african, libya, mediterranean, sea, becomes, cemetery, immigrants, world, health, organization, wala, naglabas, euro, loop, facebook

𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Mahalagang malaman na kinondena ng mga scientists ang conspiracy theory at mga usap-usapan na ang SARS-CoV-2, ang virus na nagdudulot ng COVID-19, ay nanggaling sa isang laboratory sa Wuhan, China. Mahalaga ring malaman na ayon sa isang genetic study na tiningnan ang pinagmulan ng SARS-CoV-2 ay ito ay nag-evolve naturally at hindi produkto ng isang laboratoryo sa Wuhan, China. Basahin ang mga sources sa mababa para sa mas malalim na pag-intindi. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: [ICYMI] No, Vice President Leni Robredo did not insist that call center agents should not be qualified for work from home arrangements. In fact, she was one of the first ones to insist that companies must shift to work from home arrangements or skeletal workforce in order to protect their employees. Robredo made the call only hours after the World Health Organization declared COVID-19 a pandemic. ------- Due to a large volume of requests for fact checking old posts, we will be resharing old fact checked materials with the [ICYMI] header. Fact Check Philippines March 18, 2020 · CLAIM: VP Leni does not want call center agents to work from home. VERDICT: False! Vice President Leni Robredo called for stricter measures in making sure that all employees are protected during her address to the nation regarding the changing situation of COVID-19. She also said the 4-day work weeks were also not enough and if manpower is really necessary then a skeletal staffing should be implemented. Read more about it:

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 No, it's not true that President Rodrigo Duterte will declare a total lockdown, according to a PNP post that debunked the circulating chain message. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Hindi totoong magdedeklara si Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte ng total lockdown ayon sa Facebook post ng PNP na pinapabulaanan ito. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 FALSE! No, the Philippines was not the first in Asia to impose a lockdown policy as President Rodrigo Duterte had claimed. As per the data of the Oxford COVID-19 Government Response Tracker and BBC Research, the Philippines is 5th in Asia to implement its lockdown. Among the first five (5), we are also the country with the most days between the first case and the date of lockdown implementation. It took us 45 days after the first confirmed case of COVID-19 to declare a lockdown in Metro Manila. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 FALSE! Hindi totoong tayo ang pinakauna sa Asya na magkaroon ng lockdown tulad ng sinabi ng Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte Ayon sa datos ng Oxford COVID-19 Government Response Tracker at BBC Research, ang Pilipinas ay panglima sa Asya na nagpatupad ng lockdown. Sa unang lima na nagdeklara ng lockdown, tayo ang bansa na may pinakamalaking agwat sa araw ng unang kumpirmadong kaso at sa araw ng pagdeklara ng lockdown. Inabot tayo ng apatnapu't limang (45) araw bago napatupad ang lockdown sa Metro Manila. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This fact check material was flagged by our team during the Presidential Address last April 16, 2020. Loop us in on suspicious Facebook pages, groups, accounts, websites, articles, or photos in your network by sending us a message here or contacting us through factcheckphils@gmail.com
tags: asia, president, rodrigo, duterte, oxford, government, response, tracker, research, among, metro, manila, asya, pangulong, ayon, pilipinas, inabot, presidential, address, loop, facebook

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 FALSE! No, it is not true that ABS-CBN is facing multiple cases for continuing its operations after its franchise expired. The National Telecommunications Commission (NTC) issued a memorandum order allowing the the continued operations of ABS-CBN Convergence, Inc. and other telecommunications companies during the lockdown period. Section C of the memorandum also stated that the company and other telecommunications company withe same status will be allowed to continue their operations up to sixty (60) days at the lockdown. The fake post coming from Kapusonovela also provided a false date for ABS-CBN's franchise expiration. The correct date is March 17 and not March 14. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 FALSE! Hindi totoong may kinakaharap na patong patong na kaso ang ABS-CBN dahil sa kanilang pagpapatuloy ng operasyon sa kabila ng pagtatapos ng kanilang prangkisa. Naglabas ng memorandum ang National Telecommunications Commission (NTC) na nagsasabing papayagan ang operasyon ng ABS-CBN Convergence, Inc. at ibang telecommunications company sa loob ng lockdown period. Sinabi rin ng Section C ng memorandum na papayagan nito ang mga kumpanya na mag-operate 60 days matapos ang lockdown period. Ang post rin mula kay Kapusonovela ay nagbigay ng maling petsa kung kelan matatapos ang prangkisa ng ABS-CBN. Ang tamang petsa ay March 17 at hindi March 14. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\-\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. Loop us in on suspicious Facebook pages, groups, accounts, websites, articles, or photos in your network by sending us a message here or contacting us through factcheckphils@gmail.com

text: This copy-paste script is sad and false. While South Korea has dramatically reduced its number of newly confirmed COVID-19 cases, the virus has not yet been fully eradicated. Japan also announced an emergency declaration this week in a bid to curb the spread of the virus. The declaration did not include a nationwide stay at home order. The move allows governors in seven affected regions including Tokyo to ask people to stay indoors and request that businesses close, but there are no enforcement mechanisms and no penalties for those who fail to comply. The claim that the virus is “almost gone” in China is also misleading. While the number of confirmed cases in China has dramatically fallen, officials are now trying to stem a second wave of imported cases, AFP reported here. Also, claims of citizens not criticizing needs additional context given that China has harsh censorship measures against people who criticize authorities from automatically deleting posts, banning words online, public apologies, or worst, making them disappear. SOURCE:
tags: south, korea, japan, tokyo, china, also

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 If Senator Bong Go meant that confirmed cases of COVID-19 are lower than the actual tabulated data, then that would be false, but if he meant that reported cases are different from confirmed cases then by DOH terminology, it would be true. While it is correct that reported cases are different from confirmed cases, we need to contextualize it to the fact that no massive testing has happened when the Senator made the statement. It means that the number of cases might be higher in reality since it is reported that COVID-19 carriers can sometimes be asymptomatic. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Kung ang ibig sabihin ni Senador Bong Go ay ang kumpirmadong kaso ng COVID-19 ay mas mababa sa datos ng DOH, masasabi nating ito ay mali. Ngunit kung ang ibig sabihin niya ay magkaiba ang reported cases at confirmed cases, ito naman ay tama. Bagaman totoo na ang reported cases hindi kapareho ng confirmed cases, kailangan nating ilagay ang sinabi ng Senador sa tamang konteksto na wala pang ipinapatupad na massive testing noong sinabi niya ang pahayag na ito. Ang ibig sabihin nito ay maaaring mas mataas pa ang bolang ng mga kaso ng COVID-19 dahil naiulat na maaaring hindi magpakita ng sintomas o asymptomatic ang nakakakuha ng virus. -\-\-\-\ This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 No, an "antibody treatment" being marketed by May is not yet possible. As of early April 2020, 103 candidate therapeutics were in pre-clinical trial or a stage of Phase I-IV development, with results for 29 drug candidates expected during this month. Out of 103, only 7 candidates are under late stage testing (Phase III - IV). The Philippine General Hospital (PGH) also said that their antibody plasma transfusion treatment is still under experimental stage in the Philippines. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Maaaring hindi magkaroon ng isang "antibody treatment" sa May. Sa unang bahagi ng April 2020, naitala na 103 na kandidato na gamot laban sa COVID-19 ay nasa pre-clinical trial or nasa isang sta sa Phase I-IV development. 29 sa mga ito ang mga inaasahang maglalabas ng resulta bago matapos ang buwan. Mula 103, 7 lamang sa mga ito ang nasa late stage testing development (Phase III-IV). Sinabi rin ng PGH na ang kanilang antibody plasma transfusion treatment ay nananatiling nasa experimental stage pa rin sa Pilipinas. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: -\-\- This request was submitted by a community factchecker. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 FALSE! No, Pres. Rodrigo Duterte did not call Christians "buang" or crazy and he most certainly did not curse at them in his Easter Message. Inquirer said that they never published the manipulated photo on the left and that they urge the public to be wary and mindful of the content they share. Pres. Duterte's Easter message was focused on hope and new beginnings. Meanwhile, our team also found out that the statement of the President that he was the first leader who imposed the total lockdown was also false. Outside China, Italy imposed a strong lockdown on March 9. On March 13, it was Denmark and Albania that implemented their own lockdowns then on March 14 it was Spain and Czech Republic. The Philippines finally followed the imposition of a lockdown on March 15. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 FALSE! Hindi totoong tinawag ni Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte na buang ang mga Kristiyano at lalong hindi niya minura ang mga ito sa kanyang mensahe para sa Linggo ng Pagkabuhay. Sinabi ng Inquirer na hindi totoong nilathala nila ang pekeng larawan na nasa kaliwa at pinapaalalahanan nila ang mga tao na mas maging mapanuri sa kanilang isini-share. Ang tunay na mensahe ng Pangulo ay tungkol sa pag-asa ng mga bagong simula. Samantala, nakita ng aming team na hindi totoo ang pahayag ng Pangulo na siya ang unang nagpatupad ng lockdown. Sa labas ng China, ang Italy ay nagpatupad ng "strong lockdown" noong March 9. Noong March 13, ang Denmark at Albania naman ang nagpatupad ng sarili nilang lockdown at sinundan ng Spain at Czech Republic noong March 14. Noong March 15 lang nagpatupad ng lockdown ang Pilipinas. -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\ SOURCES: LOCKDOWN DATES:

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 NEEDS ADDITIONAL CONTEXT! Before contemporary history gets revised, let us remember that several people were already pushing for the President to initiate a China-wide ban due to safety reasons as they might overwhelm our need of our own healthcare systems. 1. DOH responded with the rejection of the travel ban out of fear of political repercussions between the Philippines and China. Health Secretary Francisco Duque also said that the Philippines is not a third world country with weak healthcare system even though data showed the opposite of his claim. 2. The President and mostly his reamplified supporters in social media responded by accusing the proponents of the ban of xenophobia against the Chinese. If Duque is going to talk about the ban, we have to take it in its full context. We can't heal as one if nobody is going to take accountability for that restriction. Bago pa man mabago nang tuluyan ang kasaysayan, tandaan natin na maraming tao na noon ang umaalma kay Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte na ipatupad ang China-wide travel ban para sa kaligtasan ng ating bansa dahil maaari nilang masagad nila ang pangangailangan natin sa ating sariling healthcare system. 1. Tinanggihan ng DOH ang travel ban dahil natatakot sila sa anumang politikal na epekto nito sa pagitan ng Pilipinas at China. Sinabi rin ni Health Secretary Francisco Duque na ang Pilipinas ay hindi raw isang third-world country ang Pilipinas na may mahinang sistemang pangkalusagan. 2. Sinabi ng Presidente na tigilan ng mga nagtutulak sa travel ban ang xenophobia o pagkamuhi sa mga Chinese. Kung tatalakayin ni Duque ang travel ban, kailangan itong pag-usapan gamit ang kumpletong konteksto. text: No, Queen Elizabeth II neither did praise the president and accused the Philippines for having the worst citizens nor did curse at his supporters for creating fake news and having bad grammar. Inquirer.net published an advisory post last April 7, 2020 for a photo quote of Queen Elizabeth being manipulated: It reads: "After INQUIRER.net shared on social media an excerpt from Queen Elizabeth II’s Sunday address to the United Kingdom, the same post was manipulated to say that Duterte looked “overworked” and that the “Philippines doesn’t have the worst government, it actually has the worst citizens.”" We can go on and on how the dignified is different from the efficient but let's just put it simply that The Crown rarely does politics and for it to do so, it is frowned upon by its government as exemplified by the long reign of her majesty, Queen Elizabeth II. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 NEEDS MORE CONTEXT! The post made by the Center for Trade Union and Human Rights (Philippines) last February 14, 2020 about ATC Manufacturing Corp (LIGO) needs more context. After analyzing the sharing patterns and networks, this post by CTUHR was being used by administration-backed networks and its supporters with the intent to silence Ligo. The Center for Trade Union and Human Rights responded with additional context and an update edit to the post once they saw the situation that was unfolding last April 4, 2020. As they stay true to the documentation of labor rights, they are also against the people who are using it to stifle dissent. They had this to say: "...we do not appreciate it being used by entities with malicious intent to fuel misplaced anger or to undermine sectors of society, including businesses that are expressing valid criticisms against this government’s policies and actions in the midst of a public health crisis. Given the political climate in the country, we expect more companies to speak up against the government. We support them in doing so, even as we continue to speak out against labor rights violations." According to a representative from Ligo, they confirmed that the factory temporarily suspended their operations last February 11, 2020 in order to comply with the government order. They further explained that a choice of reassignment to another company or reinstatement was presented to the employees by their manpower agency before the temporary operations suspension. The representative added that majority of the employees were back once the factory resumed their operations last February 17, 2020.
tags: center, trade, union, human, rights, manufacturing, corp, ligo, given

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 IS THE COVID-19 AIRBORNE AS THE PRESIDENT CLAIMED? According to the WHO, NO, because liquid droplets does not make it airborne as they drop quickly on the ground and cannot travel long distances. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 MAKUKUHA NGA BA SA HANGIN ANG COVID-19 TULAD NG SINABI NG PRESIDENTE? Ayon sa WHO, hindi dahil ang laway o anumang likido na lumalabas sa hininga o bibig ay hindi sapat para sabihin na ito ay airborne dahil bumabagsak agad ang mga ito sa lupa at hindi umaabot ng malayong distansya.
tags: ayon

text: FALSE! The President did not warn everyone to prepare for the COVID-19 pandemic "at the start?" Despite the rising number of patients being probed for the COVID-19 (then named 2019-nCOV), President Duterte told everyone last February 3, 2020 that everything was well in the country as he predicted that the virus would eventually “die a natural death.” Duterte said there was no need to be hysterical about the virus, noting that only one person has died of the disease so far. “Let’s start with the narratives by saying that everything is well in the country. There is nothing really to be extra scared of that coronavirus thing although it has affected a lot of countries...You know one or two in any country is not really that fearsome,” the President opened the press briefing at Malacañang last Feb 3 2020 with this statement.
tags: president, despite, duterte, lets, malacañang, feb

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 Misleading! No, Avigan is not a vaccine. It's an antiviral drug. No, Japan does not yet have a treatment for the coronavirus as Avigan will still have to undergo clinical trials in order to get its approval as an effective and safe treatment for COVID-19. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 Misleading! Hindi totoong bakuna ang Avigan. Ito ay isang gamot kontra sa virus. Magkaiba ang paraan ng paggamit at mekanismo ng bakuna at gamot. Hindi rin totoong may gamot na ang Japan para sa coronavirus. Magsisimula pa lamang ang 'clinical trials' ng Avigan para masiguradong ito ay ligtas at epektibo laban sa COVID-19. SOURCE:
tags: misleading, avigan, japan, magkaiba, magsisimula

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 FALSE! No, Atty. Chel Diokno did not challenge President Rodrigo Duterte to a duel nor did he ask for the President's dermatologist. In a Facebook post, Diokno joked about being called to the principal's office regarding his teeth. Chel Diokno si Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte sa isang pagtutunggali o kaya naman tinanong kung sino ang kanyang 'dermatologist'. text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 MISLEADING AND LACKS CONTEXT! While it is true that actress Kristine Hermosa posted these images on her Instagram account, these were posted on two separate dates. The photo on the left of the fake news posted on April 2, 2020 while the one on the right was posted back in 2016 when she came out to support Pres. Rodrigo Duterte. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 MISLEADING AND LACKS CONTEXT! Habang totoo na naibahagi ng artistang si Kristine Hermosa ang mga larawan na ito sa kanyang Instagram, ang mga ito ay inilabas niya sa dalawang magkaibang taon. Ang larawan sa kaliwa ng fake news post ay nilabas niya noong April 2, 2020 samantalang ang nasa kanan ay inilabas noong 2016 noong nangampanya siya para kay Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte.
tags: kristine, hermosa, instagram, pres, rodrigo, duterte, pangulong

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 FALSE! No, Pres. Duterte did not congratulate the Department of Social Welfare and Development at Department of Budget and Management for successfully distributing all of the Social Amelioration Program benefits The original photo from the Philippine News Agency was a quote by Pres. Rodrigo Duterte calling upon ROTC students to assist the DSWD in distributing relief to people that are severely affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. The Presidential Communications Operations Office described the manipulated image as 'maliciously culled' and reminded people to be more responsible in sharing information online as the country battles with the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 FALSE! Hindi totoong pinasalamatan ni Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte ang Kagawaran ng Kagalingan at Pagpapaunlad Panlipunan (DSWD) at Kagawaran ng Pagbabadyet at Pamamahala (DBM) dahil sa mabilis na pamimigay ng Social Amelioration Benefits. Ang orihinal na larawan mula sa Philippine News Agency ay isang pahayag ni Pang. Duterte para sa mga ROTC students na tulungan ang DSWD sa pamimigay ng tulong sa mga taong tinatamaan ng COVID-19. Tinawag naman 'maliciously culled' ng PCOO ang pekeng larawan at pinaalalahanan din nila ang mga tao na mas maging responsable sa pagbabahagi ng impormasyon online sa kalagitnaan ng laban ng bansa laban sa COVID-19.
tags: pres, duterte, department, social, welfare, development, budget, management, amelioration, program, philippine, agency, rodrigo, presidential, communications, operations, office, pangulong, kagawaran, kagalingan, pagpapaunlad, panlipunan, pagbabadyet, pamamahala, benefits, pang, tinawag

text: Yes, people do believe it no matter how ridiculous it is. No, we're not gonna stop factchecking them.

𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 FALSE! No, Vice President Leni Robredo did not say these statement. This could be confirmed with a cursory search in search engines, media websites, and official accounts of the Vice President. 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 FALSE! Hindi totoong sinabi ni Bise Presidente Leni Robredo ang mga pahayag na ito. Sa isang 'cursory search' ay makukumpirma na walang sinabi ang Bise Presidente na ganito.

text: 𝗘𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗛 FALSE! No, DSWD's Gen. Rolando Bautista and DBM's Wendell Avisado did not say this about the government's Social Amelioration Benefits. No, the Social Amelioration benefits were not yet distributed by March 29, 2020 or April 2, 2020. On March 28, 2020, the Department of Budget and management said that they have released funds for the second quarter operating requirements of line agencies to ensure their continuous operations amid the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic. Earlier, Sec. Wendell Avisado said the government has available funds to ensure the continuity of programs, including the Build Build Build initiative. On April 2, 2020, DSWD Sec. Bautista said that they have received the P100 Billion and planned to distribute it in next three days through LGUs. This was his statement: “Nais po naming ipaalam sa lahat ng ating mga kapatid na Pilipino na hawak na po namin ang P100 billion na ito na parte ng P200 billion na intended for social amelioration fund for two months. Ito pong P100 billion ay intended for one month at dito na po mag-roll out yung mga nailatag na plano at proseso para mapadali na maibigay ang karampatang ayuda sa ating kapatid na Pilipino,” SOURCES: 𝗙𝗜𝗟𝗜𝗣𝗜𝗡𝗢 FALSE! Hindi totoong sinabi ito ni Gen. Rolando Bautista ng DWSD at ni Sec. Wendell Avisado ng DBM tungkol sa Social Amelioration Benefits. Hindi rin totoong naipamahagi na ang 'Social Amelioration Benefits' noong March 29, 2020 o April 2, 2020. Noong March 28, 2020 ay sinabi ng DBM na nailabas na nila ang pondo para sa tuloy-tuloy na operasyon ng mga mahahalagang ahensya na lumalaban sa COVID-19 sa pangalawang kwarter ng taon. Sinabi rin ni Sec. Wendell Avisado na mayroon pang pera ang gobyerno para sa pagpapatuloy ng kanilang mga programa tulad ng 'Build, Build, Build'. Noong April 2, 2020 ay sinabi naman ni DSWD Sec. Bautista na P100 Billion at plano pa lamang nilang ipahagi sa mga susunod na tatlong araw sa pamamagitan ng mga LGU. Ito ang kanyang pahayagt: “Nais po naming ipaalam sa lahat ng ating mga kapatid na Pilipino na hawak na po namin ang P100 billion na ito na parte ng P200 billion na intended for social amelioration fund for two months. Ito pong P100 billion ay intended for one month at dito na po mag-roll out yung mga nailatag na plano at proseso para mapadali na maibigay ang karampatang ayuda sa ating kapatid na Pilipino,” SOURCES:
tags: gen, rolando, bautista, wendell, avisado, social, amelioration, benefits, department, budget, earlier, sec, build, p100, billion, pilipino, p200, sinabi

text: No, this is not Dr. John Simpson. This is Johnny Sins, a pornographic actor, whose real name is Steve Wolfe. He has become a meme in social media in acting out as different professions in his pornographic career. Dr. John Simpson is credited with inventing and commercializing the first over-the-wire balloon catheter used for percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty (PTCA). This single idea created the field of interventional cardiology as we know it today. Neither Johnny Sins nor Dr. John Simpson said anything about Pres. Rodrigo Duterte. This photo will be added to our 'How The Turntables' album
