text: No, your rights do not disappear in times of state of emergencies. The 1987 Constitution only allows the suspension of the privilege of the writ of habeas corpus—a safeguard against arbitrary arrest and detention—in extraordinary circumstances. A state of emergency is not among those circumstances. According to the CHR, Although certain freedoms can be limited like movement, it still must follow the human rights framework. SOURCES:
tags: constitution

text: No, ginger, garlic, pepper, and heat are not cures for COVID-19. In response to the claim, Dr. Mark Kristoffer Pasayan, a fellow at the Philippine Society for Microbiology and Infectious Diseases, told AFP on February 12, 2020: “For all coronaviruses, there is no evidence pointing to the efficacy of this method to prevent and even cure viral infections. “Having low humidity and cold environments makes it easy for one pathogen to be transmitted from one person to another... but it is not connected with the intake of any hot food or item.” Pasayan also said the claim was a “false report”, like many circulating online, including drinking boiled garlic. Here is an AFP report on prominent online misinformation on false virus cures. The WHO also told AFP that there is not enough evidence to suggest a connection between temperature and the novel coronavirus. In an email to AFP on February 12, 2020, a spokesperson for the WHO said: “The virus is too new for us to know how weather could affect transmissibility. “The virus has affected people in cold/dry and warm/wet climates.” SOURCE:
tags: dr, mark, kristoffer, pasayan, philippine, society, microbiology, infectious, diseases

text: No, Israel has not yet developed a vaccine for COVID-19. The stock photo used in the fake news article was from a recently uploaded stock photo last January (https://www.alamy.com/coronavirus-vaccine-vial-with-injection-syringe-image340456261.html) Israel's MIGAL Research Institute has developed a vaccine for avian coronavirus, Infectious Bronchitis Virus (IBV), which is for chickens and not humans. The development of a vaccine has to undergo rigorous laboratory testing on animals and humans to make sure it is safe according to the FDA. On March 21, 2020, Jennifer Haller volunteered to be injected with a coronavirus vaccine in Seattle. The experimental vaccine was created by Moderna, an American biotechnology company in partnership with the National Institutes of Health. It will still have to go a series of laboratory testing. It is therefore false to say that a coronavirus vaccine is being mass produced. SOURCES:
tags: israel, israels, research, institute, infectious, bronchitis, virus, jennifer, haller, seattle, moderna, american, national, institutes, health

text: CLAIM: South Korea imposed a total lockdown. VERDICT: False! South Korea did not impose a total lockdown in their country. It's neighboring country, During a BBC interview, South Korea Foreign Minister Kang, Kyung-wha gave the following statement as to why they're not imposing a lockdown: "Well, I think this is being faithful to the values of our very vibrant democracy which is open and the government fully in the service of the people, and I have to say our public is very demanding and expects the highest standards from government services. And I think this is the key, the drive of our response to this. We are monitoring very closely the inbound traffic (and) we have also put in place vetting of outbound traffic, so that (not only do) we minimize the risk coming in from the inbound traffic (and) make sure that we do our very best to contain the spread within country, but also (take) steps to vet those with possible symptoms among those who are leaving the country. " Read more about it:

text: CLAIM: Banana and salt water kills coronavirus. OUR VERDICT: False and misleading. The 57-second video that circulated online caused panic buying and hoarding of bananas in wet markets and supermarkets. We're sorry to break it to you but the video is fake. The first part of the video was from ABC News Australia entitled "Race is on as Australian researchers rush to make coronavirus vaccine": https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HK7I86wjTUk The full video talked about Australian efforts to develop a coronavirus vaccine and mentioned nothing of bananas and salt water to battle the virus which meant that the succeeding clips from the fake videos were grabbed from other sources like the Wall Street Journal or some stock footage sources and was edited to put banana in a good light. The Philstar tweet: https://twitter.com/PhilstarNews/status/1239446836768718848 caught the attention of Dr. Eric Tayag of DOH and quote retweeted it with "What?" in a seemingly disbelief with the statement made by Presidential Spokesperson Sal Panelo. Absolutely no evidence has been presented linking the killing of coronavirus with banana. For saltwater, DOH Spokesperson Undersecretary Eric Domingo said, “I don’t think there is any evidence that it will kill a virus,” on a press conference last January 31, 2020. Several factcheckers have already addressed this:
tags: banana, australia, race, australian, wall, street, journal, philstar, dr, eric, tayag, presidential, spokesperson, sal, panelo, absolutely, undersecretary, domingo, several

text: Last 2019, NATO Strategic Communications COE confirmed that were four (4) types of trolling activities in our country that all fell under the for-profit scheme. In short, there are trolls for hire in the Philippines and multiple studies and news reports confirm this. Facebook even took down some pages, groups, and accounts connected to Nic Gabunada, President Duterte's 2016 Social Media Head, last March 29, 2019 for 'coordinated inauthentic behavior'. From "Chinese people in elevators" being portrayed as first-hand experiences of witnessing discrimination to "Kawawa ang presidente", these are all considered copypasta, astroturfing, and sometimes spam. Please be aware that there's a new script going around which aimed to ridicule the clamor for medical workers to be in checkpoints doing their due diligence and isolation and the second one comparing our stature to Taiwan whose economy and healthcare is more advanced than ours.

text: Just last February 4, 2020, we reported about the massive astroturfing activity during the first confirmed case of COVID-19 in our country. To recap, astroturfing in an organized activity to create a false impression of support or opposition for an entity or organization. Their script last February 4 was about encountering Chinese neighbors in an elevator or in Poblacion, Makati asking for help because they were allegedly discriminated. The massive copy-paste activity already cancelled the authenticity of that claim. In this case, they wanted the reader to feel pity towards the President and see him as a person who is trying his best. Whether or not if he was, we'll let you be the judge.

text: CLAIM: VP Leni will use the military of the United Nations to replace the PNP and the AFP. Verdict: False and misleading! It is also worth noting that the UN does not have an army but only a peacekeeping force which can only be directed a UN Security Council resolution.

text: We're reposting this from the World Health Organization. No, the COVID-19 does not spread through the air or emissions. It spreads with close contact ranging to a meter via droplets or human fluids. COVID-19 is the new name of 2019-NCOV to remove any association from any person, place, or animal to prevent any stigma that might cause harm to the entity. For example, the WHO confirmed in 2003 that Asian Palm Civets were the initial hosts of the SARS virus but this led to a misinformed belief that asian palm civets are carriers of the actual SARS virus. That false belief ignored the fact that the virus merged with a human coronavirus and mutated which led to only causing human to human transmission. Unfortunately, this led to the culling of a large population of Asian Palm Civets.
tags: world, health, organization, asian, palm, civets, unfortunately

text: CLAIM: VP Leni is Cong. Bolet Banal's Mistress OUR RATING: FALSE AND RECYCLED This fake news was first published by Rigoberto D. Tiglao back in 2018 and is still being echoed by pro-administration pages up until this day. He is a well-known manufacturer of fake news and conspiracy theories. From CIA plants to Marcos Revisionism, there is no limit to his vivid imagination. He event went to the extent of saying that the Jabidah Massacre was a hoax. After being called out by the Vice President last April 2018 for the fake news, he sent an email to her threatening to publish more fake news about her. Two years and they are still recycling, huh? Must be a creative block.

text: CLAIM: Vice President Leni Robredo currently has her residence in a 1 million mansion at New Manila, Quezon City. OUR RATING: FALSE AND MISLEADING! According to an Inquirer article dating back in 2016, VP Leni and her daughters are living in a condominium unit in Quezon City. Aside from lavishness, this was one of her motivations to reject the Coconut Palace as the place for her office. (See: https://newsinfo.inquirer.net/778383/coconut-palace-too-ostentatious-for-leni) She then chose to hold office at the Quezon City Reception House in New Manila. Once a symbol of corruption during the Estrada administration, the Office of the Vice President has now made it its headquarters back in 2016. (See: https://newsinfo.inquirer.net/790655/robredo-to-hold-office-at-qc-reception-house) While referring to the Daily Tribune piece, VP Leni said on a tweet this morning, "[This is] Fake news. QC Reception House serves as our office, NOT my residence." She added that their monthly rent is not P1M, but only half of what Jejomar Binay's Office of the Vice President used to pay for rent. Former Vice President Jejomar Binay held office at the Coconut Palace and paid P484,000 to the Government Service Insurance System (GSIS) monthly which would approximate the current rent of the Office of the Vice President at around 240,000 monthly. "Let's report these fake news peddlers", the Vice President added. ( See: https://twitter.com/lenirobredo/status/1225305564307021824?s=19) It's disgusting to see a news organization allowing lies to be printed with their consent.
tags: vice, president, leni, robredo, new, manila, quezon, city, inquirer, aside, coconut, palace, see, reception, house, estrada, office, daily, tribune, p1m, jejomar, binays, former, binay, p484000, government, service, insurance, system, lets

text: Friends don't let friends share fake stories and fake news. A copypasta is a block of text which is copied and pasted across the internet by individuals through online platforms. Since Saturday, multiple versions of two stories were sprouting left and right on Facebook and Twitter ranging from settings like airports, fast food restaurants, and elevators that could amazingly fit 100+ people if you think about it. This particular 'copypasta' is a disinformation that seeks to achieve an emotional response from the reader. The first version talks about a Chinese father and son attempting to board an elevator: “I’m sad. We have Chinese neighbors sa condo, and just now may nakasabay kaming lalaki (Chinese) with 2 kids. Sila dapat ‘yong nauna dun sa elevator. But when he saw us (Filipinos) behind him, umatras siya with his kids at nagpahuli. Hindi sila sumabay. I heard the kids asked their dad why, but he just shushed them. Kasakit man sa heart. Let's pray for each other's good health, regardless of race. This is not a time to blame and discriminate. P.S. Nobody knows the feels more than those who saw the sadness in the man's eyes. Yes, don't forget PRECAUTIONS. But don't be so overwhelmed by that and set aside COMPASSION. HUMANITY, as you say.” The second version talks about a Chinese man asking for help or asking to be seated with the line 'not sick' with settings ranging from an airport to Poblacion, Makati: “Hey, i was walking on the street to find a public vehicle when a Chinese man approached me na parang hiyang-hiya. Pansin kong iniiwasan din siya ng mga tao. Masyado pa siyang mailap tas di makatingin sa'kin, tinanong ko na kasi parang di niya talaga kaya magsalita. ' yes? you speak bisaya, tagalog or English?' tas parang nabuhayan siya na may kumausap sa kanya pero ramdam mo yung paglayo niya ng kusa. ' not sick... not sick..' nagpapanik pa siya ng kunti tapos sabi niya. ' first time here.. the driver angry.. drop me here and said... I can walk the Poblacion area.... I just wanna know direction?' parang naiiyak pa siya, it's not his efforts in speaking to be understood that broke my heart but knowing the fact that the driver lied to him. Kung lalakarin mo kasi yung lugar na binanggit niya mula dun sa kinaroroonan namin is aabutin ka ng ilang oras. I mean i know na may iba satin na galit sa kanila dahil nga sa virus na yan but being this rude and cruel. It's breaking me. You can't be mean to someone just because of their race.” A coordinated awareness campaign using fake accounts with copy-paste messages is more likely fake and political considering the context of our nation of who has the infrastructure and interests that are in line with them. The goal is to exploit the vulnerability of organic reach and human emotions to cancel out real information or rational thought from being received. Tag your friends! SOURCES:
tags: friends, since, saturday, facebook, twitter, chinese, im, filipinos, kasakit, lets, nobody, poblacion, makati, hey, pansin, english, tag

text: OUR RATING: FALSE! STOP SPREADING FAKE NEWS ABOUT DISASTERS! Kim Atienza posted this fake news chain message on his instagram. According to him this recycled fake news which has been a decade old. Back in 2014, ABS-CBN published an articled denying that Kim Atienza reported such a threat and explained why the 'cosmic rays' text message was a hoax or fake. "They spread it around whenever people are vulnerable at times of disaster. Totally untrue", he added. Reports say that similar fake news messages happened in the US and Ghana from 2008 to 2010. BBC reported back in 2010 that a text hoax in Ghana about an earthquake due to cosmic rays caused fear and panic overnight. The US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration said that in terms of health effects to humans on the ground, this background cosmic radiation, similar to the solar radiation, poses no immediate harm and cannot be considered a health risk only unless you are chronically exposed to higher radiation levels in polar regions. 1. https://www.instagram.com/p/B7OQX1xpayZ/?utm_source=ig_embed 2. https://news.abs-cbn.com/lifestyle/09/19/14/why-cosmic-rays-message-hoax 3. http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/8465619.stm 4. https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/dangerous-cosmic-gamma-rays/

text: OUR RATING: FALSE AND MISLEADING! In her recent Ulat ng Bayan where Vice President Leni Robredo released her Co-chairperson's report outlining three findings and recommendations for the drug war: 1) Balance the prioritization of clusters by transferring the chairmanship to the DDB. 2) Target HVTs and bring them to justice. 3) Organize and clean-up the data on the drug war for an evidence-based policy. Part of the concern on the first prong of her recommendations was that the status quo of which the ICAD is being headed by the PDEA was causing a misprioritization of clusters. According to her report, while the enforcement cluster was being beefed up, the advocacy, rehabilitation, and reintegration cluster were receiving the lopsided end of the funding. Along with this, she advocated for centralized programs for community-based rehabilitation, which basically means out-patient rehabilitation and is proven to be effective according to the DOH in 2017.

text: CLAIM 1: VP Leni proposed to ban guns in police drug operations. CLAIM 2: VP Leni proposed to "survey" drug lords and pusher for data. CLAIM 3: Malacanang sent a "warning letter" to the Office of the Vice President. OUR VERDICT: FALSE! Firstly, VP Leni did not propose to ban guns in police drug operations but rather proposed to end the senseless killings that enabled drug operations to kill collateral damages in the form of minors and other innocent civilians. She also proposed to have a more intensive approach towards the supply-side of the drug problem. Secondly, the evidence-based policy that VP Leni is mentioning does not mean that she plans to survey the drug lords. According to the Oxford Dictionary, evidence-based means an approach to medicine, education, and other disciplines that emphasizes the practical application of the findings of the best available current research. Thirdly, the first clue to finding out that the warning letter is fake is because of the poorly edited and cut out portions of the letter which super-imposed the signature and the seal of the President into the bottom half of the photo. Lastly, not one of the claims were reported in verifiable and high-profile media organizations and news outlets.
tags: leni, malacanang, office, vice, president, firstly, secondly, oxford, dictionary, thirdly, lastly

text: Our Rating: False, Misleading, and Lacks Context! President Duterte blamed the previous administration for losing the Panganiban Reef in a stand-off but this information was very well documented by the DFA and media organizations. The 2012 PH-China stand-off occurred in the West Philippine Sea in the Scarborough Shoal which is far from the Spratly Islands and Panganiban Reef. This withdrawal needed context as the agreement brokered by the US was followed by the Philippines but unfortunately, China amidst saying yes, further militarized the region. This stand-off became the ignition to our West Philippine Sea petition in the West Philippine Sea.

text: Our rating: FALSE! With a simple Facebook and Google search we were able to determine that this is a fake statement superimposed on a picture of Vice President Leni Robredo. That's how easy it is for Alon Calinao Dy to find out that he was spreading a recycled fake news that was first released last October 2018 unless he really knows it's fake news and it is his intent to spread it. It's either that or Dy had an exclusive interview with VP Leni elbowing every major news outlet that we have. Using our tools, we were able to find out that this post was reposted 29 times to pro-administration pages connected to Duterte, Pacquio, and "sleeper" pages waiting to be activated and renamed to a politicized page. text: Misleading! Ronald "Bato" Dela Rosa admitted in a media interview that Pacquiao fully funded his and his family's trip to watch the senator's fight against boxer Jessie Vargas in Las Vegas. The PNP chief said he did not spend a single centavo of his personal funds for the trip. He also said that the airfare, tickets, hotel accommodation, and even allowance for himself and his family were paid for by Pacquiao. Presidential Decree No. 46 prohibits public officials from receiving gifts or any other valuable thing on any occasion when the gift is given because of an official's position, regardless of whether or not the gift is given for past favors, or if the giver is expecting to receive a favor or better treatment in the future. The same prohibition against receiving gifts can also be found in Republic Act 6713, which specifies that prohibited gifts include those with a value that "is neither nominal nor insignificant. #FactCheckPH #TheFilipinoVotes
tags: misleading, ronald, bato, dela, rosa, pacquiao, jessie, vargas, las, vegas, presidential, decree, republic, act

text: Our rating: Misleading! Clarification Update: We reached out to the Freedom from Debt Coalition, the organization quoted in the Inquirer article that the fake news peddler page is using, and they confirmed that the headline of the post and the messaging in the photo used were misleading. They said that the P6.4 Trillion debt was not a product of the Aquino Administration alone contrary to the implied messaging of Thinking Minds' post. The 6.4 Trillion was the outstanding PH debt ever since the country started having debt, meaning it includes administrations before Noynoy Aquino. They confirmed that their PROJECTED data agrees with the actual BOT data that was cited in the Rappler article: "Adding guaranteed debt, the total debt as of June 2016 was P6.511 trillion, for a net increase of P1.319 trillion under Aquino." So maybe Thinking Minds and their blog would like to correct their headline and implied messaging on the photo that they used because their post is still rated as MISLEADING even by the very organization that their quoting on the article. -\-\-\-\ The data on the outstanding debt of the Philippines is readily available in the website of the Bureau of Treasury. We really don't get it why their writers won't use it. Or is it because they really don't want to use it? 🤔 Report this Fake News: Fake News Link: https://www.facebook.com/overthinkingmind/posts/1831836606917837 1. Click the three-dotted button in the upper right corner of the post. 2. Select "Give feedback on this post" 3. Select "False News" 4. Click Send Reference: Bureau of Treasury
tags: misleading, clarification, update, freedom, debt, coalition, inquirer, p64, trillion, aquino, administration, thinking, minds, noynoy, rappler, adding, p6511, p1319, bureau, treasury, select, give, reference

text: Our rating: Misleading! The chart is wrong. The math is wrong. The numbers are wrong. The intent to mislead is wrong. Hindi tama ang pinapakita sa pie chart ayon sa ekonomistang si JC Punongbayan. Mas magandang batayan pa rin ang DEBT-GDP ratio. Sa pagtatapos ng anim na taon na termino ni Aquino, ang natitirang utang ay naging P5.848 trillion. Ang net addition lamang na idinagdag ni Aquino sa utang ng Pilipinas ay P1.366 trillion. Sa dalawang taon ng Duterte administration, nadagdagan ng P1.212 trillion ang utang ng Pilipinas Report: 1. Click : 2. Click the 3-Dotted Button on the upper-right corner 3. text: Because this fake news is back. Fact Check Philippines November 23, 2018 at 1:23 PM · A blog post from opinyonko.com has been throwing shade on the issue of this footbridge. text: Rating: False This misinformation is not only below the belt as it did not spare the family of a senatorial candidate from deception but Laya Diokno is also very clear about supporting her dad by going to his sorties and representing him in events. #FactCheckPH -\-\- 6/19/2020 Update This fake news quote is circulating again! Context: "Tutol ako sa Death Penalty kahit rapin at patayin pa ang aking anak na babae." is a fake and vile statement being attributed to Atty. Chel Diokno. It was first circulated by pro-administration networks during the 2019 elections particularly after ABS-CBN's Harapan 2019 Senatorial Debate. Diokno was asked during the debate that if his child were raped or killed, should the criminal be given the death penalty to which Diokno replied: "Tutol na tutol po ako sa death penalty dahil anti-poor po ang death penalty. It is not the severity of the punishment but the certainty that stops the crime." The Free Legal Assistance Group (FLAG), to which Diokno is part of, conducted a death row survey back in 2004 which found that “the profile of death row is the profile of the poor in Philippine society: largely uneducated, largely unemployed and generally living in poverty.” In the case of People of the Philippines v Mateo (2004), the Supreme Court admitted that a vast majority of trial courts had wrongfully imposed the death penalty by 71.77% from 1993 to 2004.
tags: rating, laya, diokno, update, context, tutol, death, penalty, atty, chel, harapan, senatorial, debate, free, legal, assistance, group, philippine, people, mateo, supreme, court

text: Several facebook posts dating back to January 27, 2019 claimed that India had a street party for the visit of Duterte. That claim is misleading. text: The fake news article came a little too late when it was first published in March 2017 as VP Leni Robredo was still able to travel to the United States last October 2018 to give a talk in Washington, DC. It is also worth noting that the "US Department of States" does not exist. However, the US State Department commented on bans - they said that they do not publicize travel bans. A simple search in the State Department's website shows no statement against VP Robredo as the fake news article claims. We would like to commend the imagination of the writer behind this but Fact Check tags this story as FAKE.
tags: leni, robredo, united, states, washington, department, however, state, departments

text: Online narratives try to depict Sen. Bam Aquino as “credit-grabber”. A lot of fabricated stories are being shared creating an illusion that Sen. Bam really claimed credit for things such as the return of the Balanggiga Bells. But when you check the sources, they all come from satirical pages and fake news purveying sites. Truth be told, Sen. Bam Aquino never claimed to have any part in the return of the Balanggiga Bells. Fact Check Philippines mark this story as fake.

text: MISLEADING: A post from facebook page Vip protection agent of the Philippines organization of license bodyguards has gone viral online. To quote, “Attention to all companies::: ANG HINIHINTAY NA PANGARAP NA 14 MONTH PAY. LUMABAS NA AT NA APPROVED NA.” The post was shared to about 6,252 times and had 618 reactions and 382 comments. Though it is true that there is a pending bill in the house on the Mandatory 14th month pay for all government offices and private companies regardless of employment status, it has not yet been approved both in the Congress and Senate. Therefore, it is of no truth that we will be expecting a mandatory 14th month pay next year.

text: Another malicious post against the Senator Bam Aquino has been spreading. It says that Sen. Bam is, in a way, supporting criminals because of their contribution to the economy. The post was shared up to 2,626 times, gained about 1.8k reactions and 980 comments up to posting date. However, after verifying this from the Senator’s Office, they told Fact Check Philippines that Sen. Bam Aquino didn’t make such statement. The photo was originally from ABS-CBN posted October 7, 2017 when the Senator was interviewed on why the Senate minority blocks the 900M pesos budget for “Oplan Tokhang” Here’s the Senator’s statement: “Mas mainam na pondohan ang mga mas epektibong solusyon sa droga tulad ng community rehabilitation programs, education programs sa mga eskuwelahan at mga anti-poverty programs sa komunidad,” according to Sen. Bam Aquino “Bakit natin popondohan ang isang programa na nagdudulot ng pang-aabuso na nangyayari,”

SATIRE: A blog post has been circulating in Facebook with a headline saying that America needs a Duterte to eradicate substance abuse. At first glance, you would say “WOW. An Angelina Jolie, commending the President in its War on substance abuse.” But sadly, it’s all lies. The blog post was originally from a satire website “NewsPH” with the headline changed to fit the narrative. There was never a statement from the Hollywood actress about Duterte or the War on Drugs.

text: The 6.4% inflation poses a serious threat to us. Prices surged uncontrollably high and will continue to do so because of TRAIN Law. However, there are people who continuously deceive us for the sake of propaganda. Check this photo out. A post coming from a certain Maring D. Hambali manipulated a photo of the rice prices to Php15.00. In reality (see original photo) the rice price still as high as Php85.00 per kilo. A lot of people has been deceived by this false information. It reached about 50,000 people in Facebook with 14,000 shares across the platform. Let’s validate the facts and stop sharing false information.
tags: prices, law, however, maring, hambali, php1500, php8500, facebook, lets

text: When I watched the tete-a-tete and heard Enrile say that no person was executed during Martial Law, I took a deep breath and told myself, “This old, senile, desperate man is such a shame”. I’ve known and talked to some of the living Martial Law victims. Enrile’s lies can never nullify facts and history as long as there are people who will stand for it. Let’s start with clarifying the “NONE” in the judicial (legal) level. There were about 12 executions that happened under the regime but there were a total of 24 offences that was punishable by death. These 24 were mostly tried under military tribunals and not by the court. Hence, it was considered executive executions rather than judiciary. But other than that, there were 2,668 incidents of arrests, 306 total number of arrested individuals,398 disappearances, 1,338 salvagings, 128 frustrated salvagings and 1,499 killed or wounded in massacres, according to Task Force Detainees of the Philippines. Martial Law victims such as former DSWD secretary Judy Taguiwalo, Fe Mangahas, Rene Saguisag, Nene Pimentel, Etta Rosales, Satur Ocampo, Neri Colmenares, and other more continuously stand up and narrate what happened to them during Martial Law. Some of them were sexually tortured and harassed. Some were beaten up to death but yet, survived and continued fighting against the attack to our democracy.
tags: enrile, martial, law, ive, enriles, lets, hence, task, force, detainees, judy, taguiwalo, fe, mangahas, rene, saguisag, nene, pimentel, etta, rosales, satur, ocampo, neri, colmenares

text: Enrile claims that there were no massacres that happened during Martial Law. But guess what, pilipinas.org records about 8 massacres and during the Macos regime from 1965-1986. Two of these happened to be during the Martial Law time frame. Apart from that, there were about 5 more massacres. One of the most notable massacre was the Jabidah Massacre in 1968. New recruits of the AFP who were Moro youth were harassed and executed because of their defiance to their mission that involved killing Muslims iin Sabah. This event even led to the formation of the Moro National Liberation Front by founding chairman, Nur Misuari. In 1971, 70 Moros were also killed inside their mosque in the village of Manili in Carmen, North Cotabato. Even after Martial Law was lifted in January 17, 1981, there were massacres that occured including the Daet Massacre in Camarines Norte in June 1981, Sag-od Massacre in Northern Samar in September 1981 and Escalante Massacre in Negros Occidental in September 1985. Now, the victims of these massacres are speaking up. Telling everyone these deaths didn’t happen invalidates the suffering of those who died and suffered under Martial Law regime.
tags: enrile, martial, law, macos, two, apart, one, jabidah, massacre, new, moro, muslims, sabah, national, liberation, front, nur, misuari, moros, manili, carmen, north, cotabato, even, daet, camarines, norte, sagod, northern, samar, escalante, negros, occidental, telling

text: Pinoy Ako Blogger Troops to Calbayog to Wage War vs. Misinformation Calbayog City, Samar – The City of Calbayog will wage war against misinformation through Fact Check Philippines: A Media and Information Literacy Conference on June 30, 2018 at the I's Plant Hotel and Restaurant, Calbayog City. Fact Check PH aims to equip the young netizens of Calbayog on citizen fact checking in the era of alternative facts and post-truth. The conference is a one-day activity with lectures on the cyber warfare against misinformation and disinformation, citizen fact checking, and netizens role in social transformation. In the afternoon, participants are to engage into a workshop on how to combat the threats to truthful information. Ambassadors for Truth will be chosen to join the pool of Fact Check Ambassadors for Calbayog City and build their own Fact Check armies in each community. The participants are expected to create strategies on how they will be able to combat misinformation in their localities. The main speaker will be the blogger behind Pinoy Ako Blog, Jover Laurio. Laurio, a staunch critic of the Duterte administration, came out to expose her true identity in October 2017 after being threatened by supporters of the president. Fact Check Philippines is in partnership with Kaya Natin Movement for Good Governance and Ethical Leadership, and ENTABLADO, a cultural group in Samar.
